APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO FUND THE BUS FACILITY RENOVATION PROJECTS INCLUDING SATELLITE FACILITY ACQUIRED WITH FTA FUNDS IN JULY 2021 TO OUTFIT IT FOR TRANSIT PURPOSES. FORMALLY IT WAS USED AS A FEDEX PROCESSING CENTER AND WAREHOUSE.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: FUNDS UNDER THIS GRANT WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT THE BUS FACILITY RENOVATION PROJECTS INCLUDING SATELLITE FACILITY ACQUIRED WITH FTA FUNDS IN JULY 2021 TO OUTFIT THE FORMER FEDEX PROCESSING CENTER AND WAREHOUSE FOR TRANSIT PURPOSES.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL ALLOW THE CITY OF MADISON--METRO TRANSIT TO RENOVATE THE BUS FACILITY IN ORDER TO USE IT FOR TRANSIT BUS SERVICES AND STORAGE. THIS WILL ALLOW FOR SERVICE EXPANSION AND HELP IMPROVE SAFETY.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE BENEFIT FOR THE CITY OF MADISON AND DANE COUNTY RIDERS WILL BE THE IMPROVED TRANSIT OPTIONS WHICH ENHANCE THE PUBLIC TRANSIT EXPERIENCE.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING FOR TIRE LEASE CAPITAL COST OF CONTRACTING PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE REHAB OF FIXED ROUTE BUSES ONE NEW SERVICE TRUCK AUTOMATIC PASSENGER COUNTERS (APCS) FOR 16 BUSES AND A REPLACEMENT SHOP AIR COMPRESSOR.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED PURCHASE: ONE NEW SERVICE TRUCK APCS FOR 16 BUSES A REPLACEMENT SHOP AIR COMPRESSOR TIRE LEASE CAPITAL COST OF CONTRACTING PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE AND MID-LIFE REHAB OF FOUR FIXED ROUTE BUSES.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL ALLOW WAUKESHA METRO AND ITS CONTRACTORS TO PROVIDE MORE RELIABLE TRANSIT SERVICE PARTIALLY FUND OPERATIONS EXTEND THE USEFUL LIFE OF FIXED ROUTE BUSES PROVIDE BETTER RESOURCES FOR MAINTENANCE ACTIVITIES.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE CITY AND COUNTY OF WAUKESHA AND THE RIDERS THAT RELY ON THE TRANSIT SERVICE WILL BENEFIT FROM CONTINUED SERVICES PERMITTING WORKERS TO GET TO WORK AND OTHER DESTINATIONS. WAUKESHA METRO MAINTENANCE WILL BENEFIT BY HAVING BETTER RESOURCES TO COMPLETE THEIR WORK.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

THIS APPLICATION IS TO REQUEST SECTION 5307 5307 (CMAQ) 5337 AND 5339 FUNDS APPORTIONED TO THE MILWAUKEE UZA IN THE AMOUNT OF $2702323. IN ADDITION THE APPLICATION REQUEST SECTION 5339 FUNDS APPORTIONED TO THE STATE OF WISCONSIN IN THE AMOUNT OF $73698. THIS APPLICATION IS FOR MULTIPLE PROJECTS INCLUDING OPERATING PROJECTS (PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE 3RD PARTY CONTRACTING AND TIRE LEASE) REQUESTS FUNDING TO PURCHASE: THREE (3) FIXED ROUTE BUSES A SUPPORT VEHICLE REPLACEMENT PARK RIDE LOT LIGHTING UPGRADE MID-LIFE REHAB OF FIXED ROUTE BUSES FACILITIES REHABS AND MARKETING FUNDS. THIS APPLICATION IS FOR A TOTAL OF $3470026 WITH $2776021 FEDERAL AND $694005 LOCAL MATCH. THE FEDERAL FUNDS ARE FROM THE FOLLOWING PROGRAMS:-SECTION 5307 (CMAQ) FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $32000 IS FFY 2021:-SECTION 5307 FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $1280660 IS FFY 2022;-SECTION 5337 FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $516894 IS FFY 2019; $474538 IS FFY 2020; $267771 IS FFY 2021- SECTION 5339 FORMULA FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $204158 ($73698 WI UZA + $130460 MI UZA) IS FFY 2019THE LOCAL MATCHING SOURCE OF FUNDING FOR ALL OF THESE FUNDS WILL COME FROM CITY OF WAUKESHA AND WAUKESHACOUNTY LOCAL TAX LEVY.TO MEET THE REQUIREMENT THAT 0.75% OF FUNDS WILL BE USED ON SAFETY THE CITY OF WAUKESHA/WAUKESHA COUNTY WILL UTILIZE THE PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE FUNDS IN THIS GRANT ON GENERAL SAFETY RELATED ACTIVITIES SUCH AS REPLACEMENT LIGHTING AT FACILITIES AND GENERAL BUS MAINTENANCE.PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING FOR TIRE LEASE CAPITAL COST OF CONTRACTING PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE REHAB INTERIORS OF BOTH BUILDINGS REHAB OF FIXED ROUTE BUSES PURCHASE 3 REPLACEMENT BUSES UPGRADE PARK AND RIDE LIGHTING AND REPLACE THE ADMIN VEHICLE (SUPPORT VEHICLE). ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO PURCHASE 3 REPLACEMENT BUSES TIRE LEASE CAPITAL COST OF CONTRACTING PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE REPLACEMENT OF FLOORING IN THE TRANSIT CENTER OFFICE AND PORTIONS OF THE ADMINISTRATION OFFICES MID-LIFE REHAB OF FOUR FIXED ROUTE BUSES UPGRADE THE PARK AND RIDE LIGHTING TO LED AT GOERKES CORNERS PARK RIDE LOT AND REPLACE THE ADMIN VEHICLE. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL ALLOW WAUKESHA METRO AND ITS CONTRACTORS TO PROVIDE MORE RELIABLE TRANSIT SERVICE PARTIALLY FUND OPERATIONS IMPROVE PARK-RIDE CONDITIONS FOR PASSENGERS EXTEND THE USEFUL LIFE OF FIXED ROUTE BUSES SAFER VEHICLE FOR ADMIN STAFF AND PROVIDE BETTER WORKING CONDITIONS BY UPGRADING FLOORING IN FACILITIES FOR STAFF. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE CITY AND COUNTY OF WAUKESHA AND THE RIDERS THAT RELY ON THE TRANSIT SERVICE WILL BENEFIT FROM CONTINUED SERVICES PERMITTING WORKERS TO GET TO WORK AND OTHER DESTINATIONS. WAUKESHA METRO EMPLOYEES WILL ALSO BENEFIT THROUGH SAFER AND MORE MODERN WORKING CONDITIONS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONEDOCUMENTS ATTACHED INCLUDE THE FTA/FHWA STIP APPROVAL LETTER OF JANUARY 19 2021 RELEVANT TIP PAGES FOR THE VARIOUS PROJECTS FROM THE SEWRPC 2021-2024 TIP AND 2019 2020 2021 2022 SEWRPC FUNDING ALLOCATION LETTERS. BY EXECUTING THIS GRANT WE CERTIFY THAT PROJECTS FUNDED IN THIS GRANT ARE INCLUDED IN THE 2022 TRANSIT ASSET MANAGEMENT (TAM) PLAN INVESTMENT PRIORITIZATION SECTION. IN EXECUTING THIS GRANT THE CITY OF WAUKESHA AGREES TO ABIDE BY SECTION 3011 OF THE FAST ACT (49 U.S.C. 5323(J)(2)(C) REGARDING THE PHASED INCREASE IN DOMESTIC CONTENT UNDER THE BUYAMERICA STATUTE FOR ROLLING STOCK. AS GRANT AGREEMENT INCLUDES AN FTA-FUNDED TRANSIT VEHICLE PURCHASE RECIPIENT AGREES TO COMPLY WITH THE RELATED REQUIREMENTS SET FORTH IN 49 CFR 26.49(A). SPECIFICALLY RECIPIENT MUST ENSURE AS A CONDITION OF BEING AUTHORIZED TO BID OR PROPOSE ON FTA-ASSISTED TRANSIT VEHICLE PROCUREMENTS THAT EACH TRANSIT VEHICLE MANUFACTURER CERTIFIED THAT IT COMPLIED WITH DOT REQUIREMENTS FOR SUBMITTING A DBE PROGRAM AND GOAL TO FTA PRIOR TO BIDDING. RECIPIENT IS ALSO REQUIRED TO SUBMIT THE NAME OF THE SUCCESSFUL BIDDER AND THE TOTAL DOLLAR VALUE OF THE CONTRACT WITHIN 30 DAYS OF MAKING AN FTA- ASSISTED TRANSIT VEHICLE AWARD USING THE REQUIRED FTA REPORTING TOOL. RECIPIENT UNDERSTANDS THAT FAILURE TO COMPLY WITH THESE REQUIREMENTS MAY RESULT IN FORMAL ENFORCEMENT ACTION OR APPROPRIATE SANCTION AS DETERMINED BY FTA INCLUDING REIMBURSEMENT OF FTA FUNDS USED FOR THE VEHICLE PROCUREMENT.

START INITIAL APPLICATION (00)THIS APPLICATION INCLUDES $14333036 IN FY 2022 SECTION 5337 HIFG FUNDING FOR SYSTEM WIDE VESSEL PRESERVATION PROGRAM ACTIVITIES INCLUDING REHAB/IMPROVEMENT ACTIVITIES THAT WILL EXTEND THE USEFUL LIFE OF THE VESSELS. BY EXECUTING THIS GRANT WE CERTIFY THAT PROJECTS FUNDED IN THIS GRANT ARE INCLUDED IN THE 2020 TAM PLAN INVESTMENT PRIORITIZATION SECTION.END INITIAL APPLICATION (00)PURPOSE:THIS GRANT WILL ALLOW SYSTEM WIDE VESSEL PRESERVATION INCLUDING REHAB/IMPROVEMENT ACTIVITIES THAT WILL EXTEND THE USEFUL LIFE OF THE VESSELS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:SYSTEMWIDE VESSEL PRESERVATION AND IMPROVEMENT TO EXTEND THE USEFUL LIFE OF THE ASSET INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE FOLLOWING: RENOVATE REPLACE AND/OR UPGRADE VESSEL SYSTEMS INCLUDING STEEL STRUCTURES STRUCTURAL PRESERVATION SYSTEMS INTERIOR SPACES PIPING AND PROPULSION MAJOR MECHANICAL /ELECTRICAL COMMUNICATION / NAVIGATION / LIFESAVING AND SECURITY EQUIPMENT. IT INCLUDES PROCUREMENT OF LONG-LEAD CAPITAL VESSEL COMPONENTS (OWNER FURNISHED EQUIPMENT) TO BE INSTALLED DURING SHIPYARD PERIODS. IT MAY ALSO INCLUDE EMERGENCY REPAIRS HULL MAINTENANCE AND PRESERVATION REGULATORY COMPLIANCE AND ENHANCEMENTS FOR THE WSF FLEET. EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THE PROJECT WILL HAVE SOME OR ALL OF THE FOLLOWING BENEFITS DEPENDING ON WHICH SPECIFIC VESSEL PRESERVATION AND IMPROVEMENT PROJECTS ARE FUNDED. SUSTAIN LOWERED FLEET OPERATING COSTS SUSTAIN LOWERED EQUIPMENT OPERATING COSTS REDUCE UNSCHEDULED REPAIR MEET OR EXCEED USEFUL LIFE MEET OR EXCEED ASSET MANAGEMENT PLAN SUSTAIN FERRY SAFETY AND SECURITY INCREASE SERVICE RELIABILITY INCREASE OPERATIONAL SAFETY IMPROVE SYSTEM EFFICIENCY AND RELIABILITY.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:FERRY CUSTOMERS WHO UTILIZE WSF FERRY SERVICE THROUGHOUT THE WSF SYSTEM.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITY:THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENTS TO THIS GRANT.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO USE $114587 IN FY20 AND $110729 IN FY21 SECTION 5337 HIMB PROGRAM FUNDS AND $680494 IN FY20 AND $644722 IN FY21 SECTION 5339(A) PROGRAM FORMULA FUNDS FOR THE COMBINED PURCHASE OF APPROXIMATELY FOUR (4) DIESEL BUSES THAT WILL REPLACE VEHICLES IN THE EXISTING FIXED ROUTE FLEET WHICH HAVE SURPASSED THEIR USEFUL LIVES. BOTH PROJECTS COMBINED WILL FUND A TOTAL OF FOUR VEHICLES BEING REPLACED UNDER THIS APPLICATION.PURPOSE:C-TRAN WILL USE THE FUNDS TO ASSIST IN THE PURCHASE OF APPROXIMATELY FOUR (4) DIESEL BUSES THAT WILL REPLACE VEHICLES IN THE EXISTING FIXED ROUTE FLEET WHICH HAVE SURPASSED THEIR USEFUL LIVES..ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:THIS GRANT WILL PURCHASE APPROXIMATELY FOUR (4) REPLACEMENT DIESEL BUSES.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THE EXPECTED OUTCOME WILL BE FOUR (4) NEW DIESEL BUSES THAT WILL REPLACE VEHICLES IN THE EXISTING FLEET WHICH HAVE SURPASSED THEIR USEFUL LIVES REDUCED MAINTENANCE COSTS IMPROVED SERVICE HEADWAYS AND ASSISTING THE AGENCYS EFFORTS TO MAINTAIN A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:C-TRAN RIDERS WILL BENEFIT FROM CONTINUED RELIABLE BUS SERVICES AND SUSTAINED VEHICLE SAFETY.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:N/ABY EXECUTING THIS GRANT WE CERTIFY THAT PROJECT FUNDED WITH THIS GRANT ARE INCLUDED IN THE 2021 TAM PLAN INVESTMENT PRIORITIZATION SECTION.

PURPOSE: THIS APPLICATION INCLUDES $9523866 OF 2021 SECTION 5337 FUNDING FOR SYSTEM WIDE VESSEL PRESERVATION PROGRAM ACTIVITIES INCLUDING REHAB/IMPROVEMENT ACTIVITIES THAT WILL EXTEND THE USEFUL LIFE OF THE VESSELS AS WELL AS VESSEL PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE. IT INCLUDES PROCUREMENT OF LONG-LEAD CAPITAL VESSEL COMPONENTS (OWNER FURNISHED EQUIPMENT) TO BE INSTALLED DURING SHIPYARD PERIODS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THE PROJECT WILL HAVE SOME OR ALL OF THE FOLLOWING BENEFITS DEPENDING ON WHICH SPECIFIC VESSEL PRESERVATION AND IMPROVEMENT PROJECTS ARE FUNDED. SUSTAIN LOWERED FLEET OPERATING COSTS SUSTAIN LOWERED EQUIPMENT OPERATING COSTS REDUCE UNSCHEDULED REPAIR MEET OR EXCEED USEFUL LIFE MEET OR EXCEED ASSET MANAGEMENT PLAN SUSTAIN FERRY SAFETY AND SECURITY INCREASE SERVICE RELIABILITY INCREASE OPERATIONAL SAFETY IMPROVE SYSTEM EFFICIENCY AND RELIABILITY.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:FERRY CUSTOMERS WHO UTILIZE WSF FERRY SERVICE THROUGHOUT THE WSF SYSTEM.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITY:THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENTS TO THIS GRANT.

PURPOSE OF AWARDTHE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ALLOCATE ALL OF THE AVAILABLE FY2021 SECTION 5337 STATE OF GOOD REPAIR GRANTS PROGRAM APPORTIONED FOR THE AUSTIN URBANIZED AREA ($3074341) THIS 5337 APPLICATION GRANT IS CONSISTENT WITH OUR TAM PLAN. THE PLAN WAS COMPLETED IN 2017 AND WILL BE UPDATED IN 2021. CAP METRO CERTIFIES BY EXECUTING THIS GRANT THAT PROJECTS FUNDED IN THIS GRANT ARE INCLUDED IN THE 2017 TAM PLAN INVESTMENT PRIORITIZATION SECTION. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMEDTHE FEDERAL FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE WILL BE USED TO REIMBURSE COSTS INCURRED FOR ELIGIBLE FIXED GUIDEWAY REHABILITATION ACTIVITIES WHICH INCLUDE THE INCORPORATION OF CURRENT DESIGN STANDARDS AND ADDITIONAL FEATURES REQUIRED BY FEDERAL STATE AND LOCAL LAWS. SPECIFICALLY CAPITAL METRO WILL APPLY THE FUNDS TOWARD COSTS INCURRED FOR ACQUISITION AND INSTALLATION OF FIBER DUCTBANK MATERIALS WHICH ARE NECESSARY FOR ITS POSITIVE TRAIN CONTROL (PTC) SYSTEM. EXPECTED OUTCOMESTHE PTC IS A FEDERALLY MANDATED SYSTEM INTENDED TO RELIABLY AND FUNCTIONALLY PREVENT TRAIN-TO-TRAIN COLLISION OVER-SPEED DERAILMENTS INCURSIONS INTO ESTABLISHED WORK ZONE LIMITS AND THE MOVEMENT OF A TRAIN THROUGH AN IMPROPERLY POSITIONED SWITCH. THE FUNDING IN THIS GRANT WILL ONLY BE APPLIED TOWARD A SPECIFIC PORTION (FIBER DUCTBANK) OF THE CAPITAL METROS PTC SYSTEM. THE NON-FEDERAL MATCH FOR THIS GRANT IS DERIVED FROM LOCAL DEDICATED SALES TAX REVENUE (DIRECTLY-LEVIED BY CAPITAL METRO). DCTA IS THE DESIGNATED RECIPIENT FOR FY20 5337 FORMULA FUNDING FOR THE DENTON-LEWISVILLE UZA IN THE AMOUNT OF $1972516. FUNDING WILL REIMBURSE EXPENSES SUCH AS COSTS TO MAINTAIN REPAIR CLEAN INSPECT AND SERVICE ALL ROLLING STOCK AND EQUIPMENT; MAINTAIN TRACK RIGHT-OF-WAY BUILDINGS AND STRUCTURES STATION PLATFORMS FACILITIES AND SIGNAL AND COMMUNICATIONS; INSPECT AND MAINTAIN ALL BRIDGES CULVERTS PEDESTRIAN OVERPASSES AND STRUCTURES. THIS IS AN FFY 2022 SECTION 5337 UZA APPLICATION IN THE AMOUNT OF $5080802 (FEDERAL SHARE $5080802 AND $1016160 ON TRANSPORTATION DEVELOPMENT CREDITS (TDCS) FOR PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE VESSEL REPAIRS FOR THE MARITIME TRANSPORTATION SERVICES (ISLAND SERVICE). THIS APPLICATION INCLUDES LAPSING FUNDS OF FY2019 SECTION 5337 HIGH INTENSITY FIXED GUIDEWAY STATE OF GOOD REPAIR (UZA).PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING FOR PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE AND VESSEL REPAIRS TO THE VESSELS USED TO OPERATE THE PUERTO RICO ISLAND FERRY SERVICE. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO COVER ELIGIBLE PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE (INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO HEAVY PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE) AND VESSEL REPAIR EXPENSES TO BRING AND MAINTAIN ASSETS IN A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL ALLOW THE AUTHORITY TO MEET PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE STANDARDS CONTINUE TO PROVIDE SERVICE OPERATIONS AND KEEP ASSETS IN A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE AUTHORITY AND THE PASSENGERS THAT RELY ON A DAILY BASIS ON THE ISLAND SERVICE FERRY SYSTEM.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE ACTIVITIES AND VESSEL REPAIRS WILL BE CARRIED OUT BY THE MARITIME TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM UNDER THE PUERTO RICO INTEGRATED TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY A SUBRECIPIENT OF THE PUERTO RICO HIGHWAY AND TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY. THE MARITIME TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM UNDER THE PUERTO RICO INTEGRATED TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY (PRITA) PROVIDES THE ONLY PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION METHOD THAT CONNECTS THE MUNICIPAL ISLANDS OF VIEQUES AND CULEBRA WITH THE MAINLAND (ISLAND SERVICE). AS OF DECEMBER 15 2021 THE AUTHORITY COMMENCED ITS TRANSITION PROCESS WITH THE PRIVATE OPERATOR WHO WAS SELECTED THROUGH A COMPETITIVE PROCESS UNDER THE PUERTO RICO PUBLIC PARTNERSHIP (P3) LAWS. AS OF TODAY THE AUTHORITY UNDER ITS PRIVATE OPERATOR HMS FERRIES OPERATES SCHEDULED FERRY SERVICES FOR CARGO AND PASSENGERS RUNNING SEVEN (7) DAYS A WEEK. AS PART OF THE TRANSITION PROCESS THE OPERATOR IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE OF ALL THE AUTHORITYS ASSETS INCLUDING FTA FUNDED VEHICLES AND TERMINALS. CURRENTLY THE OPERATOR IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE MAINTENANCE AND OPERATIONS OF ALL THE ISLAND AND METRO SERVICE TERMINALS AND OF TWO FTA FUNDED VESSELS (CAYO LARGO AND ISLA BONITA). THE OPERATOR ALONG WITH THE AUTHORITY IS ALSO RESPONSIBLE FOR THE REPAIRS AND MAINTENANCE OF THE FOLLOWING FTA FUNDED VESSELS FOR THE ISLAND SERVICE: ISLENO SANTA MARIA AND CAYO BLANCO (CURRENTLY IN DRYDOCK). THE ISLAND SERVICE UNDER THE MARITIME TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM OPERATES A SCHEDULED SERVICE FROM CEIBA - VIEQUES AND FROM CEIBA - CULEBRA USING THE FOLLOWING TERMINALS:O VIEQUES - ISABEL II TERMINAL O CULEBRA - SARDINAS TERMINALO CEIBA - ROOSEVELT ROADS TERMINAL STIP/TIP INFORMATION: STIP AMENDMENT #3 (FY 2019-2022) SECTION 5337 - HIGH INTENSITY FIXED GUIDEWAY STATE OF GOOD REPAIR (UZA) PAGE FTA-79 LINE NUM.1. TAM PLAN: THIS PROJECT WHICH CONSIST OF FUNDS 5337 CAN BE FOUND IN THE ATM TAM PLAN UNDER INVESTMENT PRIORITIZATION UNDER SECTION 9.1 MAJOR FLEET MAINTENANCE. SECTION 5337 ASSETS ARE INCLUDED IN THE INVENTORY OF THE TAM PLAN OF PRHTA. THIS TAM PLAN WILL FOLLOW FTAS FINAL IMPLEMENTING RULE. 49 U.S.C. 5337(A)(4)(B)COST ESTIMATES: ESTIMATES WERE PROVIDED BY AN ASSESSMENT AND ICE COMPLETED BY A SUBJECT MATTER EXPERT (A RETIRED US COST GUARD MEMBER) ALONG WITH THE AUTHORITY. THESE COSTS WERE REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY PRITA AND PRHTA. ATTACHED DOCUMENTS:1. COST ESTIMATE - ISLENO DD SOW ICE2. TDC LETTER4. DRYDOCK SCHEDULE5. DETAILED SOW - ISLENO DD SOW6. STIP AMENDMENT #3 (FY 2019-2022) SECTION 5337 - HIGH INTENSITY FIXED GUIDEWAY STATE OF GOOD REPAIR (UZA) PAGE FTA-79 LINE NUM.1ALL THIRD-PARTY PROCUREMENT POLICIES WILL BE FOLLOWING AT A MINIMUM FTA C 4220.1F. PRHTA WILL ENSURE ALL PROCURED CONTRACTORS ARE NOT ON THE FTA SUSPENSION AND DEBARMENT LIST.

THIS GRANT WILL FUND IMPORTANT TRANSIT PROJECTS INCLUDING VEHICLES FACILITY UPGRADES ELECTRIC INFRASTRUCTURE IMPROVEMENTS PM ADA EQUIPMENT PURCHASES SECURITY UPGRADES AND OTHER IMPORTANT TRANSIT PROJECTS. THESE PROJECTS ARE PART OF OUR COMPREHENSIVE PROCESS OF ENSURING OUR VARIOUS ASSETS ARE KEPT IN A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR TO ENSURE WE CAN CONTINUE TO PROVIDE QUALITY TRANSIT SERVICES TO THE RIDING PUBLIC THAT DEPENDS ON US FOR THEIR TRANSPORTATION NEEDS. RTA MAINTAINS A FIVE YEAR CAPITAL PLAN APPROVED BY OUR BOARD OF TRUSTEES ON AN ANNUAL BASIS TO GUIDE OUR CAPITAL PROGRAM EFFORTS.THE INITIAL GRANT WILL USE FFY2021 ALLOCATIONS/AWARDS AND WE PLAN TO AMEND IN THE FUTURE TO ADD FUTURE ALLOCATIONS AND AWARDS.THE INITIAL GRANT IS BEING FUNDED AS FOLLOWS:GDRTA FFY2021 5307 ALLOCATION $14009417GDRTA FFY2021 5337 ALLOCATION $12824870GDRTA FFY2021 5339 ALLOCATION $1206665GDRTA FFY2020 5310 ALLOCATION $685117GDRTA FFY2021 5310 ALLOCATION $77004FHWA TRANSFER TO 507 URBANIZED AREA FORMULA GRANTS $26932865339B $4324608TOTAL FUNDING OF $35820967 - COPIES OF FUNDING DOCUMENTS ARE ATTACHEDFLEET INFORMATION IS ATTACHED - INCLUDING NOTES OF BUSES TO BE REPLACEDBY EXECUTING THIS GRANT WE CERTIFY THAT PROJECTS FUNDED IN THIS GRANT ARE INCLUDED IN THE 2018 TAM PLAN INVESTMENT PRIORITIZATION SECTION.GDRTA AGREES TO ABIDE BY SECTION 3011 OF THE FAST ACT (49 U.S.C. 5323(J)(2)(C) REGARDING THE PHASED INCREASE IN DOMESTIC CONTENT UNDER THE BUY AMERICA STATUTE FOR ROLLING STOCK.AS GRANT AGREEMENT INCLUDES AN FTA-FUNDED TRANSIT VEHICLE PURCHASE RECIPIENT AGREES TO COMPLY WITH THE RELATED REQUIREMENTS SET FORTH IN 49 CFR 26.49(A). SPECIFICALLY RECIPIENT MUST ENSURE AS A CONDITION OF BEING AUTHORIZED TO BID OR PROPOSE ON FTA-ASSISTED TRANSIT VEHICLE PROCUREMENTS THAT EACH TRANSIT VEHICLE MANUFACTURER CERTIFIED THAT IT COMPLIED WITH DOT REQUIREMENTS FOR SUBMITTING A DBE PROGRAM AND GOAL TO FTA PRIOR TO BIDDING. RECIPIENT IS ALSO REQUIRED TO SUBMIT THE NAME OF THE SUCCESSFUL BIDDER AND THE TOTAL DOLLAR VALUE OF THE CONTRACT WITHIN 30 DAYS OF MAKING A FTA- ASSISTED TRANSIT VEHICLE AWARD USING THE REQUIRED FTA REPORTING TOOL. RECIPIENT UNDERSTANDS THAT FAILURE TO COMPLY WITH THESE REQUIREMENTS MAY RESULT IN FORMAL ENFORCEMENT ACTION OR APPROPRIATE SANCTION AS DETERMINED BY FTA INCLUDING REIMBURSEMENT OF FTA FUNDS USED FOR THE VEHICLE PROCUREMENT.REQUIRED LOCAL MATCH FUNDING FROM GDRTA DEDICATED LOCAL SALES TAX AND CAPITAL REPLACEMENT FUNDS CURRENTLY ON DEPOSIT.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE NIAGARA FRONTIER TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY $4524487 IN FFY23 SECTION 5337 FUNDING TO SUPPORT TRANSIT RAIL SERVICE.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: SECTION 5337 - METRO RAIL PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE FUNDING WILL BE USED FOR RAIL PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE INCLUDING ALL THE ACTIVITIES SUPPLIES MATERIAL LABOR SERVICES AND ASSOCIATED COSTS REQUIRED TO PRESERVE OR EXTEND THE FUNCTIONALITY AND SERVICEABILITY OF THE ASSETS. THE PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE LINE ITEM IN THIS GRANT SUPPORTS MAINTENANCE ACTIVITIES FOR RAIL EQUIPMENT AND FACILITIES AS DEFINED IN THE NATIONAL TRANSIT DATABASE REPORTING MANUAL.SECTION 5337 - FASTENER PAD REPLACEMENT PHASE 11 FUNDING WILL BE USED TO ASSESS THE OVERALL EXISTING CONDITIONS OF THE RAIL TRACK SYSTEM. SECTION 5337 CATENARY INSULATOR REPLACEMENT FUNDING WILL BE USED TO REPLACE THE REMAINING ORIGINAL OVERHEAD CATENARY CONTACT WIRE FOR THE NFTA LIGHT RAIL RAPID TRANSIT (LRRT) SYSTEM.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE FUNDING USED FOR METRO RAIL PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE HELPS TO ENSURE THAT NFTA IS PROVIDING WELL MAINTAINED AND SAFE TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS FOR ALL TRANSIT RIDERS. THE FASTENER AND PAD PROJECT WILL HELP DETERMINE THE EXISTING STATUS OF THE METRO RAIL SYSTEM AND MAKE THE NEEDED REPAIRS TO MAINTAIN A SAFE EFFICIENT AND RELIABLE TRACK. THE CATENARY AND INSULATOR PROJECT WILL REPLACE VARIOUS PORTIONS OF THE SYSTEM THAT SHOWS SIGNS OF WEAR AND CORROSION.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: 5337 STATE OF GOOD REPAIR FUNDING PROVIDES CAPITAL ASSISTANCE FOR MAINTENANCE REPLACEMENT AND REHABILITATION PROJECTS TO HELP TRANSIT AGENCIES MAINTAIN ASSETS IN A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR. THIS FUNDING IS USED FOR SAFETY RELATED PROJECTS WHICH ALLOWS NFTA TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE SAFE EFFICIENT AND CONVENIENT PUBLIC TRANSIT THROUGHOUT BUFFALO NY. BOTH BUS AND RAIL PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE ACTIVITIES ARE A TOP PRIORITY FOR NFTA. UTILIZING THESE FUNDS FOR SAFETY EXPENSES ENSURES THE SAFETY OF THE TRANSIT RIDER FRONTLINE TRANSIT WORKFORCE AND THE SAFETY OF THE PUBLIC. PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE IS VITAL TO FLEET HEALTH WHICH OVERALL REDUCES RISK FOR TRANSIT OPERATIONS.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: N/A

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THESE FUNDS IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING FOR THE REPLACEMENT OF HEATERS IN THE BUS STORAGE AREA. THE CURRENT HEATERS ARE FAILING AND ARE NO LONGER SUPPORTED BY THE MANUFACTURER. THIS GRANT APPLICATION IS TO REQUEST SECTION 5337 HIGH INTENSITY FIXED GUIDEWAY STATE OF GOOD REPAIR FUNDS APPORTIONED TO THE LAS VEGAS-HENDERSON NV URBANIZED AREA (UZA CODE 320900) IN THE AMOUNT OF $7187342 AND SECTION 5337 HIGH INTENSITY MOTORBUS STATE OF GOOD REPAIR FUNDS APPORTIONED TO THE LAS VEGAS-HENDERSON NV URBANIZED AREA (UZA CODE 320900) IN THE AMOUNT OF $1493105. THE REGIONAL TRANSPORTATION COMMISSION OF SOUTHERN NEVADA REQUESTS FTA SECTION 5337 APPROPRIATED FFY 2019 HIGH INTENSITY FIXED GUIDEWAY STATE OF GOOD REPAIR FUNDING OF $2805592; APPROPRIATED FFY 2020 HIGH INTENSITY FIXED GUIDEWAY STATE OF GOOD REPAIR FUNDING OF $2167085; APPROPRIATED FFY 2021 HIGH INTENSITY FIXED GUIDEWAY STATE OF GOOD REPAIR FUNDING OF $2214665; APPROPRIATED FFY 2019 HIGH INTENSITY MOTORBUS STATE OF GOOD REPAIR FUNDING OF $356461; APPROPRIATED FFY 2020 HIGH INTENSITY MOTORBUS STATE OF GOOD REPAIR FUNDING OF $579529; AND APPROPRIATED FFY 2021 HIGH INTENSITY MOTORBUS STATE OF GOOD REPAIR FUNDING OF $557115.PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PURCHASE OF ELEVEN (11) CNG FIXED ROUTE REPLACEMENT VEHICLES THAT WILL BE PRIMARILY USED ON A FIXED GUIDEWAY SYSTEM. PROJECTS ARE INCLUDED IN THE FISCAL YEARS 2021-2025 STIP FFY2021 LATEST FEDERAL APPROVAL DATE 6/2/2021. (STATE TIP ID: CL20150010 LOCAL ID: 2050) PLEASE SEE THE ATTACHED STIP APPROVAL. PROJECT STARTS 8/12/2021 AND ENDS ON 12/31/2022 AND WILL BE USING LAPSING 5337 FFY2019 FUNDS. ALL STATE OF GOOD REPAIR FUNDS ARE CONSISTENT WITH THE RTCS CURRENT TRANSIT ASSET MANAGEMENT (TAM) PLAN. CURRENT TAM PLAN HAS BEEN PROVIDED AS AN ATTACHMENT TO THIS APPLICATION.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: ELEVEN (11) FIXED ROUTE BUSES THAT PRIMARILY OPERATE ON FIXED GUIDEWAYS WILL BE REPLACED. ALL ACTIVITIES PROPOSED IN THIS APPLICATION WILL TAKE PLACE WITHIN THE BOUNDARIES OF THE REGIONAL TRANSPORTATION COMMISSION OF SOUTHERN NEVADA (RTC) DISTRICT. THERE ARE NO OTHER TRANSIT PROVIDERS IN THE SERVICE AREA. EXPECTED OUTCOMES:CONTINUED SAFE AND EFFECTIVE OPERATION OF TRANSIT SERVICE FOR THE RESIDENTS OF CLARK COUNTY NV.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:THE RTC AS WELL AS FIXED ROUTE CLIENTS WILL BENEFIT FROM MORE RELIABLE SERVICE WITH NEW VEHICLES. THE ENTIRE COMMUNITY BENEFITS FROM A REDUCTION OF NOX PM2.5 AND HC EMISSIONS. THE TRANSIT AGENCYS GOAL IS TO HAVE A FLEET OF ALL LOW OR NO EMISSIONS VEHICLES. THE TRANSIT AGENCY WILL ALSO BENEFIT BY REDUCING MAINTENANCE COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH THE OLDER VEHICLES WHICH HAVE REACHED THEIR USEFUL LIVES. CNG VEHICLES WILL ALSO BENEFIT THE AGENCY BY REDUCING FUELING COSTS. THESE REDUCTIONS IN FUEL COSTS COULD POTENTIALLY BE PASSED ON TO TRANSIT RIDERS THROUGH IMPROVED FREQUENCY INCREASES AND IMPROVED ON-TIME PERFORMANCESUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THERE ARE NO SUB-RECIPIENTS WHICH WILL BE IN RECEIPT OF OR ASSOCIATED WITH ANY PROJECTS WITHIN THIS APPLICATION. THE RTC IS THE METROPOLITAN PLANNING ORGANIZATION (MPO) FOR SOUTHERN NEVADA. THEREFORE SEPARATE MPO CONCURRENCE IS NOT REQUIRED. THE $1531843 LOCAL MATCH IS PROGRAMMED IN THE RTCS CAPITAL IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM. RTC IS EXPERIENCING CONTRACT DELAYS DUE TO NATIONWIDE SUPPLY CHAIN ISSUES IMPACTING VEHICLE PRODUCTION AND DELIVERY TIMELINES.BECAUSE THE GRANT INCLUDES ONLY VEHICLE PROCUREMENTS THERE ARE NO TRANSIT ENHANCEMENT OR SECURITY PROJECTS.

KCATA IS APPLYING FOR A TOTAL OF $2528503 OF STATE OF GOOD REPAIR FIXED GUIDEWAY AND MOTOR BUS FUNDS TO PURCHASE A TOTAL OF SIX (6) BUS RAPID TRANSIT (BRT) REPLACEMENT VEHICLES USED IN THE PROVISION OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICE TO REPLACE VEHICLES THAT HAVE MET THEIR USEFUL LIFE. FUNDING SUMMARY:THIS GRANT INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING STATE OF GOOD REPAIR FUNDING: FY 2019 5337 STATE OF GOOD REPAIR/FIXED GUIDEWAY $1106338 FY 2020 5337 STATE OF GOOD REPAIR/FIXED GUIDEWAY $284156 FY 2021 5337 STATE OF GOOD REPAIR/FIXED GUIDEWAY $289814 FY 2022 5337 STATE OF GOOD REPAIR/FIXED GUIDEWAY $439716FY 2022 5337 STATE OF GOOD REPAIR/MOTOR BUS $408479 GRAND TOTAL FEDERAL $ 2528503LOCAL FUNDS $ 446206TOTAL PROJECT COST: $2974709LOCAL MATCH - LOCAL FUNDING SOURCES INCLUDE CONTRACTUAL AGREEMENTS WITH LOCAL COMMUNITIES 1/2 CENT TRANSPORTATION SALES TAX AND 3/8 CENT ATA SALES TAX. PURPOSE: KCATA IS APPLYING FOR A TOTAL OF $2528503 OF STATE OF GOOD REPAIR FIXED GUIDEWAY AND MOTOR BUS FUNDS TO PURCHASE A TOTAL OF SIX (6) BUS RAPID TRANSIT (BRT) REPLACEMENT VEHICLES USED IN THE PROVISION OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICE TO REPLACE VEHICLES THAT HAVE MET THEIR USEFUL LIFE. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: KCATA IS APPLYING FOR FUNDING TO PURCHASE A TOTAL OF SIX ( 6 ) KCATA REVENUE REPLACEMENT VEHICLES TO BE USED IN THE PROVISION OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICE. FIVE (5) VEHICLES WILL BE ACQUIRED FOR THE FIXED GUIDEWAY SERVICE AND ONE (1) VEHICLE WILL BE ACQUIRED UNDER THE STATE OF GOOD REPAIR MOTORBUS PROGRAM.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:SERVICE RELIABILITY ON-TIME PERFORMANCE AND SAFETY ARE STRONGLY INFLUENCED BY THE CONDITION OF THE CAPITAL ASSETS. NEW RELIABLE TRANSIT BUSES ARE ESSENTIAL FOR SUSTAINING AND INCREASING TRANSIT RIDERSHIP. IMPROVING AND MAINTAINING BUSES SO THAT PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SYSTEMS ARE IN GOOD OPERATING CONDITION AND KEEPING PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SYSTEMS IN A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR IS ESSENTIAL TO SUSTAINING EXISTING TRANSPORTATION SERVICES PROVIDING MOBILITY AND SUPPORTING LIVABLE COMMUNITIES. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:THIS PROJECT WILL BENEFIT TRANSIT RIDERS IN KANSAS CITY AND THE KCATA SERVICE AREA. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:THERE IS NO SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITY ASSOCIATED WITH THIS GRANT APPLICATION. PROJECT LOCATION: KANSAS CITY AND SURROUNDING METROPOLITAN AREA. OTHER INFORMATION: TIP/TIP- PROJECTS IN THIS GRANT APPLICATION WERE APPROVED IN THE FY 2020-2024 CURRENT TIP. THE ONE DOT STIP APPROVAL DATE IS NOVEMBER 12 2019. A COPY OF THE FY 2022 FTA MASTER AGREEMENT WILL BE RETAINED ON FILE. THE FY 2022 CERTIFICATIONS AND ASSURANCES HAVE BEEN ATTACHED TO THE RECIPIENT ORGANIZATION DOCUMENTS. CCR EXPIRATION DATE FOR KCATA IS MARCH 18 2023.ITS- THE ATA CONTINUES TO DEVELOP AN ITS SYSTEM THAT PROVIDES VOICE AND DATA COMMUNICATION WITH ALL ATA TRANSIT VEHICLES THROUGHOUT THE KANSAS CITY METROPOLITAN AREA. THIS SYSTEM IS THE BASIS FOR CURRENT AND FUTURE TRANSIT ITS APPLICATIONS AND DATA SHARING WITH OTHER REGIONAL ITS SYSTEMS. THE TRANSIT ITS SYSTEM ADHERES TO THE REGIONAL ITS ARCHITECTURE AND TCIP STANDARDS. IT HAS BEEN DESIGNED IN ANTICIPATION OF FUTURE COMMUNICATION AND DATA SHARING WITH OTHER REGIONAL INTELLIGENT TRANSPORTATION SYSTEMS. TRANSIT PROVIDERS IN AREA: THE KANSAS CITY AREA TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY (KCATA) IS THE BI-STATE REGIONAL TRANSIT AUTHORITY CREATED IN 1965. KCATA IS RESPONSIBLE FOR PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION IN THE KANSAS CITY URBANIZED AREA WITH A SEVEN-COUNTY JURISDICTION - CASS CLAY JACKSON AND PLATTE IN MISSOURI; AND JOHNSON LEAVENWORTH AND WYANDOTTE IN KANSAS. KCATA IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE PROVISION OF FIXED-ROUTE BUS RAPID TRANSIT (BRT) FLEX-ROUTE AND COMPLIMENTARY PARATRANSIT PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION IN THE REGION. KCATA OPERATES FROM A SINGLE MAINTENANCE AND ADMINISTRATION FACILITY IN KANSAS CITY MISSOURI. JOHNSON COUNTY KANSAS TRANSPORTATION AND INDEBUS OPERATED BY THE CITY OF INDEPENDENCE MISSOURI SYSTEMS ARE MANAGED BY KCATA AND THE BUS OPERATED BY UNIFIED GOVERNMENT OF WYANDOTTE COUNTY/KANSAS CITY KANSAS ARE OTHER TRANSIT PROVIDERS THAT FEED INTO AND PROVIDE SIMILAR SERVICE IN THE KANSAS CITY URBANIZED AREA. TVM COMPLIANCE - EACH TRANSIT VEHICLE MANUFACTURER (TVM) WILL BE REQUIRED AS A CONDITION OF BEING AUTHORIZED TO BID OR PROPOSE ON FTA-ASSISTED TRANSIT VEHICLE PROCUREMENTS TO CERTIFY THAT IT HAS COMPLIED WITH THE TVM REQUIREMENTS OUTLINED ON 49 CFR 26.49. ALTERNATIVELY KCATA ON BEHALF OF JOHNSON COUNTY MAY AT ITS DISCRETION AND WITH FTA APPROVAL ESTABLISH PROJECT-SPECIFIC GOALS FOR DBE PARTICIPATION IN THE PROCUREMENT OF TRANSIT VEHICLES IN LIEU OF THE TVM COMPLYING WITH THIS ELEMENT OF THE PROGRAM. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: ACTIVITIES BEING UNDERTAKEN IN THIS AWARD WILL BENEFIT THE RIDERS OF THE METROLINK LIGHT RAIL SYSTEM ASSOCIATED TRANSIT STAFF AND THE REGION OVERALL INCLUDING THE SURROUNDING COMMUNITIES. THIS APPLICATION IS TO REQUEST SECTION 5307 AND 5337 FUNDS APPORTIONED TO THE MINNEAPOLIS/ST. PAUL UZA IN THE AMOUNT OF $24238174 FOR: PURCHASE OF 18 REPLACEMENT ARTIC BUSES; RUST MITIGATION FOR LIGHT RAIL VEHICLES; IMPROVEMENTS TO RAIL TRANSITWAY AND RAIL FACILITIES; AND PURCHASE OF FARE COLLECTION EQUIPMENT.THE FEDERAL FUNDS ARE AS FOLLOWS:SECTION 5307 $14798174SECTION 5337 HIGH INTENSITY FIXED GUIDEWAY $9240000SECTION 5337 HIGH INTENSITY MOTORBUS $200000THE FEDERAL FUNDS WILL BE MATCHED BY $5041712 LOCAL FUNDS FOR A TOTAL OF $29279886. ALL FUNDS ARE FY 2022.LOCAL FUNDS ARE:$3714592 DEBT SERVICE FUNDS$1327120 REGIONAL TRANSIT CAPITALPURPOSE: THE PROPOSED GRANT WILL ALLOW METRO TRANSIT TO PURCHASE UP TO 18 SIXTY-FOOT REPLACEMENT BUSES TO BE USED IN 2023. THE BUSES WILL BE LOW-FLOOR SIXTY-FOOT BIO-DIESEL BUSES. THIS GRANT WILL ALSO INCLUDE RUST MITIGATION FOR LIGHT RAIL VEHICLES; IMPROVEMENTS TO RAIL TRANSITWAY AND RAIL FACILITIES; AND PURCHASE OF FARE COLLECTION EQUIPMENT.TO MEET THE REQUIREMENT THAT 0.75% OF FUNDS WILL BE USED ON SAFETY THE METROPOLITAN COUNCIL WILL UTILIZE THE BUY REPLACEMENT ARTICULATED BUS ALI FUNDS. NEW BUSES SUPPORT A MORE RELIABLE WITH IMPROVED SAFETY FEATURES FOR CUSTOMERS. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED TO PROCURE EIGHTEEN 60-FOOT BIO-DIESEL REPLACEMENT BUSES AND ITS RELATED INSPECTION SERVICES. THE BUSES WILL BE DELIVERED IN 2023 AND WILL HAVE A USEFUL LIFE OF 12 YEARS; HAVING RUST MITIGATION PERFORMED ON LRVS; IMPROVEMENTS TO MULTIPLE FACILITIES; PURCHASE AND INSTALLATION OF FARE COLLECTION EQUIPMENT.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS FUNDING WILL ALLOW METRO TRANSIT TO REPLACE BUSES THAT HAVE MET 12-YEAR USEFUL LIVES. THE PURCHASE OF THESE BUSES IS IN ALIGNMENT WITH METRO TRANSIT PLANNED FLEET REPLACEMENT CYCLE AND ALLOWS FOR A RELIABLE SIXTY-FOOT BUS FLEET. THIS INVESTMENT REFLECTS THE COUNCILS COMMITMENT TO MAINTAIN A RELIABLE TRANSIT SYSTEM WITHIN THE METRO REGION. OTHER WORK IS TO ENSURE VEHICLES EQUIPMENT AND FACILITIES MEET THEIR USEFUL LIFE AND REMAIN IN A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: METRO TRANSIT AND THE RIDERS THAT DEPEND ON TRANSIT SERVICES WILL BENEFIT FROM CONTINUED RELIABLE SERVICE.ANY SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONEIN EXECUTING THIS GRANT THE METROPOLITAN COUNCIL AGREES TO ABIDE BY SECTION 3011 OF THE FAST ACT (49 U.S.C. 5323(J)(2)(C) REGARDING THE PHASED INCREASE IN DOMESTIC CONTENT UNDER THE BUY AMERICA STATUTE FOR ROLLING STOCK.AS GRANT AGREEMENT INCLUDES AN FTA-FUNDED TRANSIT VEHICLE PURCHASE RECIPIENT AGREES TO COMPLY WITH THE RELATED REQUIREMENTS SET FORTH IN 49 CFR 26.49(A). SPECIFICALLY RECIPIENT MUST ENSURE AS A CONDITION OF BEING AUTHORIZED TO BID OR PROPOSE ON FTA-ASSISTED TRANSIT VEHICLE PROCUREMENTS THAT EACH TRANSIT VEHICLE MANUFACTURER CERTIFIED THAT IT COMPLIED WITH DOT REQUIREMENTS FOR SUBMITTING A DBE PROGRAM AND GOAL TO FTA PRIOR TO BIDDING. RECIPIENT IS ALSO REQUIRED TO SUBMIT THE NAME OF THE SUCCESSFUL BIDDER AND THE TOTAL DOLLAR VALUE OF THE CONTRACT WITHIN 30 DAYS OF MAKING AN FTA- ASSISTED TRANSIT VEHICLE AWARD USING THE REQUIRED FTA REPORTING TOOL. RECIPIENT UNDERSTANDS THAT FAILURE TO COMPLY WITH THESE REQUIREMENTS MAY RESULT IN FORMAL ENFORCEMENT ACTION OR APPROPRIATE SANCTION AS DETERMINED BY FTA INCLUDING REIMBURSEMENT OF FTA FUNDS USED FOR THE VEHICLE PROCUREMENT.BY EXECUTING THIS GRANT WE CERTIFY THAT PROJECTS FUNDED IN THIS GRANT ARE INCLUDED IN THE 2022 TRANSIT ASSET MANAGEMENT (TAM) PLAN INVESTMENT PRIORITIZATION SECTION.DOCUMENTS ATTACHED INCLUDE STIP/TIP PAGES STIP APPROVAL LETTER INDIRECT CFR INDIRECT RATE APPROVAL LETTER AND LIST OF BUSES TO BE REPLACED.

THE DETROIT TRANSPORTATION CORPORATION (DTC) REQUESTS FUNDING FROM SECTIONS 5307 AND 5337 TO SUPPORT MULTIPLE CAPITAL PROJECTS. THE TOTAL REQUEST OF $4348398 (FEDERAL: $3478718 AND COMPREHENSIVE TRANSPORTATION FUND (CTF): $869680)) WILL ASSIST IN MAINTAINING THE DETROIT PEOPLE MOVER (DPM) SYSTEM IN A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR PER THE TRANSIT ASSET MANAGEMENT (TAM) PLAN. TOTAL SECTION 5307 FUNDING INCLUDES: FEDERAL (80%): $929220 CTF (20%): $232305 TOTAL (100%): $1161525 AS ITEMIZED BELOW : - FFY 2020- FEDERAL (80%): $459834 CTF (20%): $114959 TOTAL (100%): $574793. - FFY 2021- FEDERAL (80%): $469386 CTF (20%): $117347 TOTAL (100%): $586733.TOTAL SECTION 5337 FUNDING INCLUDES: FEDERAL (80%): $2549498 CTF (20%): $637375 TOTAL (100%): $3186873 AS ITEMIZED BELOW: - FFY 2020- FEDERAL (80%): $1285614 CTF (20%): $321403 TOTAL (100%): $1607017. - FFY 2021- FEDERAL (80%): $1263884 CTF (20%): $315971 TOTAL (100%): $1579855.PROJECTS FUNDED BY FY 2020 AND 2021 AWARDS INCLUDE: (1) SYSTEM INSPECTIONS REPAIRS AND COMPONENTS; (2) GUIDEWAY VEHICLE STATION FACILITY AND EQUIPMENT IMPROVEMENTS; (3) POWER EQUIPMENT AND SUBSTATIONS UPGRADES; (4) PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE; (5) SIGNAL COMMUNICATION SIGNAGE AND SECURITY EQUIPMENT UPGRADES; (6) OPERATIONAL SUPPORT EQUIPMENT UPGRADES; (7) ENGINEERING AND PLANNING SERVICES; (8) TAM PLAN DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION; AND (9) ALL OTHER IMPROVEMENTS TOWARD THIS EFFORT. BY EXECUTING THIS GRANT WE CERTIFY THAT PROJECTS FUNDED UNDER THIS GRANT ARE INCLUDED IN THE TRANSIT ASSET MANAGEMENT PLAN INVESTMENT PRIORITIES SECTION.THE FOLLOWING DOCUMENTS ARE ATTACHED IN TRAMS FOR FISCAL YEARS 2020 AND 2021: (1) DTC STIP PROJECTS; (2) RTA APPORTIONMENT LETTERS; (3) LONG RANGE TIP PROJECTS; AND (4) SEMCOG REGIONAL WORK PLANS. PURPOSE OF THE AWARD: SECTION 5307 5337 FUNDING WILL ASSIST DTC IN PROACTIVELY MAINTAINING THE DETROIT PEOPLE MOVERS (DMP) INFRASTRUCTURE IN A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR AND TOWARD OPERATING A SAFE EFFICIENT RELIABLE AND SUSTAINABLE DPM SERVICE THAT ENHANCES RIDERS MOBILITY AROUND THE DETROIT DOWNTOWN AREA.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: DTC ANTICIPATES PERFORMING A WIDE RANGE OF ACTIVITIES VIA SECTIONS 5307 5337 AWARDS. THESE INCLUDE: (1) SYSTEM INSPECTIONS REPAIRS AND COMPONENTS; (2) GUIDEWAY VEHICLE STATION FACILITY AND EQUIPMENT IMPROVEMENTS; (3) POWER EQUIPMENT AND SUBSTATIONS UPGRADES; (4) PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE; (5) SIGNAL COMMUNICATION SIGNAGE AND SECURITY EQUIPMENT UPGRADES; (6) OPERATIONAL SUPPORT EQUIPMENT UPGRADES; (7) ENGINEERING AND PLANNING SERVICES; (8) TAM PLAN DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION; AND (9) ALL OTHER IMPROVEMENTS TOWARD THIS EFFORT. SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES WILL MINIMALLY INCLUDE: PERFORMING TRACK INSPECTIONS AND REPAIRS ENSURING THE UPKEEP OF ELEVATORS AND ESCALATORS WITHIN ALL PASSENGER STATIONS UPGRADING THE CCTV SYSTEM IN ALL STATIONS AND TRAINS PERFORMING ONGOING PREVENTATIVE MAINTENANCE IMPLEMENTING AN EFFECTIVE TAM SYSTEM UPGRADING THE FEED-IN-DEVISE (FID) TRAINING EMPLOYEES TO SUPPORT SYSTEM UPGRADES UPGRADING TECHNOLOGIES THROUGHOUT THE SYSTEM ETC. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE ONGOING PRESERVATION OF THE DPM LIGHT RAIL SYSTEM ENSURES ITS ASSETS REMAIN IN AN OPTIMAL STATE. THE COLLECTIVE OUTCOMES OF THE ANTICIPATED ACTIVITIES WILL ASSIST IN ACHIEVING THIS GOAL. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THERE ARE TWO (2) PRIMARY BENEFICIARIES FROM APPLYING SECTIONS 5307 5337 AWARDS. ONE ALL DPM RIDERS THROUGH AN IMPROVED QUALITY OF SERVICE. AND TWO THE DTC FROM PROACTIVELY MAXIMIZING THE UTILIZATION OF DPM ASSETS TO ACHIEVE LONG-TERM COSTS SAVINGS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: N/A

THE WORCESTER REGIONAL TRANSIT AUTHORITY (WRTA- GRANTEE AND FISCAL AGENT) REQUESTS $1915832 OF FY13 CARRYOVER SECTION 5337 STATE OF GOOD REPAIR APPORTIONMENT FUNDS FOR A PROGRAM OF CAPITAL PROJECTS THAT WILL CONTINUE TO BRING UP TO A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR AND ADD ADDTIONAL FEATURES TO THE UNION STATION INTERMODAL FACILITY LOCATED AT 2 WASHINGTON SQUARE WORCESTER MA WHICH WAS REOPENED TO THE PUBLIC IN JULY 2000. THE WORCESTER REDEVELOPMENT AUTHORITY (WRA)IS THE OWNER AND OPERATOR OF UNION STATION. THE WRTA AND WRA ARE IN THE PROCESS OF DEVELOPING AN MOU THAT ESTABLISHES ROLES RESPONSIBILITIES AND WILL ENSURE THE WRTA SATISFACTORY CONTINUING CONTROL. THE PROJECTS WILL ENABLE THE WORCESTER REDEVELOPMENT AUTHORITY ON BEHALF OF THE CITY OF WORCESTER AS THE SUB RECIPIENT OF THIS GRANT AND THE OTHER VARIOUS TRANSPORTATION ENTITIES WITHIN THE INTERMODAL FACILITY TO CONTINUE PROVIDING A RELIABLE RESPONSIVE AND SAFE SERVICE TO THE PUBLIC. CURRENTLY THE MBTA RUNS FORTY TRAINS A DAY THROUGH UNION STATION WHILE AMTRAK PETER PAN GREYHOUND AND THE WRTA ALSO PROVIDE DAILY SERVICE TO THE STATION.THE FOLLOWING PROJECTS WILL BE FUNDED TO REPAIR THE FACILITY AND TO BRING IT UP TO A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR:1. DESIGN AND RENOVATE/CONSTRUCT FIRST FLOOR PUBLIC RESTROOMS2. DESIGN AND RENOVATE/CONSTRUCT TAXI QUEUE 3. PROCURE AND INSTALL INTERIOR AND EXTERIOR SIGNAGE4. PROCURE AND INSTALL SECURITY CAMERAS5. WALL AND DRAINAGE SYSTEM LEAK REPAIR6. PROCURE AND INSTALL MARQUEE LIGHTING7. PROCURE AND INSTALL ELECTRONIC MESSAGE BOARDS8. UGRADE AND INSTALL AUTOMATED LIGHTING CONTROL9. RENOVATE HANDICAP RAMPTHE CITY OF WORCESTER WILL PROVIDE THE LOCAL MATCH IN THE AMOUNT OF $478958. ON JULY 17 2012 THE CITY OF WORCESTER ISSUED A LOAN ORDER IN THE AMOUNT OF $575000 (LETTER ATTACHED) TO FUND THE PROJECTS AT UNION STATION. AS A RESULT THIS APPLICATION SHOWS AN ALLOCATION OF $478958 OF THE CITYS $575000 LOAN ORDER.THE WRTA CURRENTLY PROVIDES PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SERVICES WITHIN THE CITY OF WORCESTER AND THIRTY-SEVEN (37) TOWNS IN ITS SERVICE DELIVERY AREA. THE AREA COMPRISES OVER 500000 IN POPULATION AND CAN BE CHARACTERIZED AS HAVING AN URBAN CORE OF 180000 (EST.) POPULATION IN THIRTY EIGHT SQUARE MILES SURROUNDED BY SUBURBAN AREAS. ALL ADMINISTRATIVE AND STATUTORY REQUIREMENTS HAVE BEEN MET ACCORDING TO 49 USC SECTION 5337/ MAP-21 SECTION 20027. AN MOU IS BEING DRAFTED BETWEEN THE WRTA AND THE WRA FOR THE WRTA TO EXERCISE CONTINUING CONTROL OVER THE ITEMS IN THIS GRANT.

THE MBTA HEREBY REQUESTS THE FTAS APPROVAL FOR $5.1M ($4080000 FEDERAL FUNDS/ $1020000 MBTA REVENUE BOND MATCH) OF SECTION 5337 FUNDS FOR THE REPLACEMENT OF HARDWARE AND UPGRADES TO SOFTWARE FOR THE AUTOMATIC FARE COLLECTION SYSTEMS (AFCS) CENTER COMPUTER AND IT INFRASTRUCTURE FOR SUBWAYS AND THE SILVER LINE.BACKGROUNDTHE INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY DIRECTORATE (ITD) OF THE MASSACHUSETTS BAY TRANSIT AUTHORITY (MBTA) IS REQUESTING $5100000 IN FEDERAL GRANT FUNDS TO PROVIDE FOR THE REPLACEMENT OF HARDWARE AND UPGRADES TO SOFTWARE FOR THE AUTOMATIC FARE COLLECTION SYSTEMS (AFCS) CENTER COMPUTER AND IT INFRASTRUCTURE. THIS PROJECT WILL ENABLE THE MBTA TO REPLACE HARDWARE THAT THAT HAS REACHED THE MANUFACTURERS ESTABLISHED END-OF-LIFE PROVIDE UPGRADES TO CRITICAL SOFTWARE AND TO CONTINUE ITS COMPLIANCE WITH THE PAYMENT CARD INDUSTRY DATA SECURITY STANDARD (PCI DSS). THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THIS PROJECT WILL BRING THE ENTIRE AFCS IT INFRASTRUCTURE (NOT INCLUDING REVENUE-HANDLING/CUSTOMER INTERACTION SYSTEM COMPONENTS) SUPPORTING THE SYSTEM UP TO STATE OF GOOD REPAIR. THE PROJECT WILL ENSURE THAT THE RELIABILITY OF THE AFC SYSTEM INFRASTRUCTURE DOES NOT DETERIORATE ALLOWING MBTAS CUSTOMERS AND EMPLOYEES TO CONTINUE TO ENJOY SATISFACTORY SYSTEM PERFORMANCE.SCOPE:THE SCOPE OF WORK WITHIN THE PROJECT WILL INCLUDE ALL DESIGN PROCUREMENT IMPLEMENTATION TESTING AND DOCUMENTATION REQUIRED TO BRING THE AFC IT INFRASTRUCTURE UP TO A GOOD STATE OF GOOD REPAIR. THE PROJECT WILL IMPROVE THE OVERALL RELIABILITY AND FAULT-TOLERANCE OF THE AFC SYSTEM. TO IMPLEMENT THE SCOPE THE PROJECT WILL BE PERFORMED IN TWO PHASES CONSISTING OF - 1) THE REPLACEMENT OF END-OF-LIFE HARDWARE AND SOFTWARE AT ALL THE STATIONS. 2) THE REPLACEMENT OF END-OF-LIFE HARDWARE AND SOFTWARE IN THE COMPLEX CENTRAL COMPUTING SYSTEM. PHASE 2 REQUIRES A SLIGHTLY LONGER LEAD TIME OVER PHASE I DUE TO THE COMPLEXITY IN NATURE. IT WILL ALSO UPGRADE THE SECURITY OF GARAGE WIRELESS NETWORKS. THE PROJECT HAS THE FOLLOWING COMPONENTS:1. PROJECT DEVELOPMENT (PROFESSIONAL SERVICES) - INCLUDES DESIGN AND DEFINING THE SOLICITATION EVALUATION CRITERIA.2. CONTRACT ADVERTISEMENT AWARD (MATERIAL DEPT.) - ADVERTISE SELECT AND AWARD PROCESS FOR PROJECTS FURNISH AND INSTALL CONTRACT.3. SYSTEM PROCUREMENT INSTALLATION (CONTRACTOR) - CONTRACTOR WILL PROVIDE ALL MATERIALS AND LABOR TO FURNISH INSTALL AND ACTIVATE THE NEW HARDWARE AND SOFTWARE. REQUIREMENTS WILL INCLUDE: (1) PROCURING IT HARDWARE TO REPLACE AFC DATA EQUIPMENT AT THE DATA CENTERS AND CONTROLLERS AT ALL SUBWAY STATIONS AND BUS GARAGES; (2) PROCURING AND INSTALLING UPGRADED DATABASE SOFTWARE; (3) COORDINATING THE INSTALLATION AND ACTIVATION OF SOFTWARE WITH SYSTEM SUPPLIER SCHEIDT AND BACHMAN; (4) CONDUCT ACCEPTANCE TESTING; AND (5) PROVIDE SYSTEM DOCUMENTATION. THE USEFUL LIFE OF THE REPLACEMENT HARDWARE IS 5 TO 7 YEARS.FINANCING:$5.1M ($4080000 FEDERAL FUNDS/ $1020000 MBTA REVENUE BOND MATCH). THIS PROJECT WILL BE FULLY FUNDED BY THIS GRANT.THE MBTA IS THE LARGEST TRANSIT PROVIDER IN NEW ENGLAND AND THE FIFTH LARGEST IN THE COUNTRY. THE MBTA DIRECTLY OPERATES OR CONTRACTS OUT FOR SERVICE USING EIGHT DIFFERENT MODES: HEAVY RAIL LIGHT RAIL BUS RAPID TRANSIT LOCAL/EXPRESS BUS TRACKLESS TROLLEY COMMUTER RAIL COMMUTER BOAT AND PARATRANSIT. IN BOSTON 55% OF ALL WORK TRIPS AND 42% OF ALL TRIPS INTO DOWNTOWN ARE MADE BY TRANSIT. THE MBTA DISTRICT IS MADE UP OF 175 COMMUNITIES WITH A TOTAL POPULATION OF 4.7 MILLION. ALMOST THREE-QUARTERS OF ALL MASSACHUSETTS RESIDENTS LIVE WITHIN THE MBTA SERVICE AREA.THE ACTIVITIES IN THIS GRANT ARE INCLUDED IN THE CURRENT MA STIP AS AMENDED. THE MBTA IS CURRENT WITH ALL CIVIL RIGHTS SUBMISSIONS AND FTA ANNUAL CERTIFICATIONS.

THIS IS A MBTA REQUEST FOR $279507215 OF FORMULA FUNDS APPORTIONED TO THE BOSTON AND PROVIDENCE UZAS FOR 5307 AND 5337 FUNDS FOR A PROGRAM OF CAPITAL PROJECTS INCLUDING:- UPGRADING AND MODERNIZING SYMPHONY STATION- THE PROJECT WILL UPGRADE SYMPHONY STATION TO A MODERN ACCESSIBLE CODE-COMPLIANT FACILITY. THE PROJECT IMPROVES ACCESSIBILITY TO ONE OF THE LAST GREEN LINE STATIONS IN BOSTON PROPER WITHOUT AN ACCESSIBLE PATH TO THE PLATFORM.- ATTLEBORO STATION IMPROVEMENTS- THIS PROJECT INCLUDES MINOR ROUTINE MAINTENANCE ACTIVITIES NEEDED AT ATTLEBORO STATION TO ENSURE SAFETY AND REMOVE HAZARDS. THIS SCOPE OF WORK DOES NOT INCLUDE WORK THAT WOULD CONSTITUTE AN ALTERATION TO THE STATION. ALL WORK WILL BE EXECUTED IN A PHASED MANNER ENSURING THAT ACCESSIBLE PATHS OF TRAVEL ARE MAINTAINED.- GREEN LINE B BRANCH CONSOLIDATION- THIS PROJECT WILL CONSOLIDATE FOUR CURRENT MBTA LIGHT RAIL SURFACE TRANSIT STATIONS INTO TWO NEW FULLY CODE COMPLIANT SURFACE TRANSIT STATIONS ((1). BU WEST 2). ST. PAUL STREET 3). PLEASANT ST AND 4). BABCOCK STREET STATIONS WILL BE CONSOLIDATED). THE NEW STATIONS WILL DRAMATICALLY IMPROVE SAFETY BY PROVIDING RAMPED WALKWAYS TO RAISED PLATFORMS WITH BENCHES CANOPIES LIGHTING AND FENCING TO SEPARATE CUSTOMERS FROM STREET TRAFFIC. TRAVEL TIMES ON THE B BRANCH WILL BE REDUCED BY UP TO 2-3 MINUTES IMPROVING GREEN LINE RELIABILITY AND CUSTOMER SERVICE. THE TWO NEW STATIONS WILL BE LOCATED IN-BETWEEN INTERSECTIONS REPLACING THE FOUR STATIONS THAT ARE PRESENTLY LOCATED AT INTERSECTIONS.- REPLACING THE NORFOLK AVENUE BRIDGE- TO REPLACES EXISTING DEFICIENT STEEL GIRDER SUPERSTRUCTURE INCREASES OVERALL SYSTEM SAFETY DECREASE MAINTENANCE COSTS. SUBSTANTIAL COMPLETION 1/21/2022.- REPLACING THE EAST COTTAGE STREET BRIDGE- TO REPLACE EXISTING DEFICIENT STEEL GIRDER SUPERSTRUCTURE INCREASES OVERALL SYSTEM SAFETY DECREASE MAINTENANCE COSTS. SUBSTANTIAL COMPLETION 1/21/2022.- CONSTRUCTION OF THE QUINCY BUS FACILITY- THE REPLACEMENT OF THE QUINCY BUS FACILITY IS PART OF THE MBTAS BUS FACILITY MODERNIZATION PROGRAM. THE CURRENT QUINCY BUS FACILITY IS LOCATED AT 954 HANCOCK STREET QUINCY MA. THE NEW BUILDING WILL BE LOCATED AT THE PROPERTY 599 BURGIN PARKWAY QUINCY MA. THE EXISTING BUILDING AT THE PROPERTY AT 599 BURGIN PARKWAY WILL BE DEMOLISHED. THE MBTA WILL BUILD A NEW MODERN LEED AND ENVISION CERTIFIED BUILDING WITH ALL SYSTEMS AND EQUIPMENT NECESSARY TO MEET THE MODERN VEHICLE NEEDS OF THE MBTA.- COMPLETE REPLACEMENT OF ALL TRACK POWER AND SIGNAL ASSETS AT KEY RED LINE INTERLOCKINGS THAT WILL NOT BE RENEWED THROUGH OTHER CAPITAL IMPROVEMENT PROJECTS (PARK STREET HARVARD KENDALL ASHMONT SECTION 16 AND BROADWAY). THE PRIMARY BENEFIT IS THAT THESE KEY INTERLOCKINGS WILL BROUGHT BACK INTO A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR WHICH WILL SIGNIFICANTLY REDUCE STOP CODES AND HITS TO ON-TIME-PERFORMANCE. SUBWAY OPERATIONS WILL HAVE GREATER FLEXIBILITY AND WILL BE ABLE TO RELY ON THESE INTERLOCKINGS IN THE EVENT OF EMERGENCIES.- DMA BUS PROCUREMENT- PROCUREMENT OF 45 60-FT ENHANCED ELECTRIC HYBRID (EEH) BUSES TO REPLACE THE 2004-06 NEOPLAN DUAL MODE ARTICULATED (DMA) BUS FLEET TO SUPPORT SILVER LINE SERVICE INCLUDING THE ZERO-EMISSIONS TUNNEL CHELSEA GATEWAY EXPANSION MASSPORT AIRPORT OPERATIONS AND OTHER YET-TO-BE-DETERMINED HIGH-DENSITY ROUTES. THESE BUSES WILL IMPROVE MBTA OPERATIONS AND DECREASE MAINTENANCE COSTS.- FIRST PHASE OF THE PROCUREMENT OF 102 LIGHT RAIL VEHICLES (LRVS) (PLUS OPTIONS OF UP TO AN ADDITIONAL 124 CARS DEPENDING ON FUTURE MBTA NEEDS) TO REPLACE THE EXISTING GREEN LINE TYPE 7 AND TYPE 8 FLEETS BRINGING THE MBTAS GREEN LINE FLEET INTO A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR AND ADA COMPLIANCE.THESE PROJECTS WILL MAINTAIN ASSETS IN A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR IMPROVE OPERATIONAL EFFICIENCY AND ENHANCE ACCESSIBILITY.FUNDING WILL INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING FUNDING PROGRAMS AND YEARS: 5307 2017 $105605672020 - $639635222021 - $115453418TOTAL $18997750753372019 - $40632269 2020 - $47526109TOTAL $881583785337- THESE FUNDS WERE APPORTIONED TO GATRA BUT ACCORDING TO THE ATTACHED AGREEMENT WILL BE UTILIZED BY THE MBTA FOR ATTLEBORO STATION.2016 - $2683892018 - $1102941TOTAL: $1371330LOCAL MATCH WILL BE FROM MBTA REVENUE BONDS. THIS APPLICATION IS TO REQUEST SECTION 5307 FORMULA FUNDS AND SECTION 5337 STATE OF GOOD REPAIR FUNDS AS FOLLOWS:PROJECT 1 MAINTENANCE OVERHAUL PROJECT 2022SECTION 5307 FORMULA FUNDSCHICAGO UZA 3 FFY 2018 $6284420CHICAGO UZA 3 FFY 2019 $2814474CHICAGO UZA 3 FFY 2020 $3017464CHICAGO UZA 3 FFY 2021 $7196158SOUTH BEND UZA 136 FFY 2020 $1340492SOUTH BEND UZA 136 FFY 2021 $1342974TOTAL SECTION 5307 FORMULA FUNDS: $21995982PROJECT 2 STATE OF GOOD REPAIR PROJECT 2022SECTION 5337 STATE OF GOOD REPAIR (SOGR) FUNDSCHICAGO UZA 3 FFY 2019 $8720960CHICAGO UZA 3 FFY 2020 $15488133CHICAGO UZA 3 FFY 2021 $937157SOUTH BEND UZA 136 FFY 2020 $2846677SOUTH BEND UZA 136 FFY 2021 $2912465TOTAL SECTION 5337 SOGR FUNDS: $30905392PURPOSE: THIS GRANT APPLICATION WILL CONSISTS OF TWO PROJECTS ONE THAT REQUESTS SECTION 5307 FORMULA FUNDING AND ONE THAT REQUESTS SECTION 5337 STATE OF GOOD REPAIR FUNDING. THIS GRANT WILL FINANCE ACTIVITIES ASSOCIATED WITH NICTDS COMMUTER RAIL SERVICE.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE FIRST PROJECT MAINTENANCE OVERHAUL PROJECT 2022 WILL PROVIDE FUNDING IN PART FOR NICTDS PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE PROJECTS ASSOCIATED WITH THE RIGHT OF WAY MAINTENANCE (BRIDGES STATIONS AND FACILITIES TRACK ELECTRICAL AND SIGNAL SYSTEMS) AS WELL AS MAINTENANCE OF NICTDS EQUIPMENT REVENUE PASSENGER VEHICLES AND SUPPORT VEHICLES. THIS FUNDING WILL BE USED TO FINANCE IN PART THE DIRECT LABOR COSTS OF THESE PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE PROJECTS AS WELL AS ELIGIBLE PURCHASES ASSOCIATED WITH THE MAINTENANCE. THE TOTAL PROJECT COST IS $27494978 WITH THE LOCAL SHARE ($5498996) COMING FROM NICTDS GENERAL FUND WHICH CONSISTS OF PROCEEDS FROM THE STATE OF INDIANAS COMMUTER RAIL SERVICE FUND AND TRACKAGE RIGHTS PAYMENTS FROM THE SOUTH SHORE (FREIGHT) RAILROAD THAT OPERATES ON NICTDS TRACKAGE AND ALSO FROM NICTDS ALLOCATION OF FUNDING FROM THE INDIANA STATE PUBLIC MASS TRANSPORTATION FUND (PMTF). PRE-AWARD AUTHORITY IS BEING RESERVED FOR THE PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE ACTIVITY. THE SECOND PROJECT STATE OF GOOD REPAIR PROJECT 2022 WILL FINANCE CAPITAL PROJECTS. NICTDS CAPITAL PROJECT PROGRAM IS COMPILED IN CONSIDERATION OF THE TRANSIT ASSET MANAGEMENT (TAM) PLAN. BY EXECUTING THIS GRANT WE (NICTD) CERTIFY THAT PROJECTS FUNDED IN THIS GRANT ARE INCLUDED IN THE 2018 TRANSIT ASSET MANAGEMENT PLAN INVESTMENT PRIORITIZATION SECTION. AT THIS TIME NICTDS SYSTEM IS CONSIDERED TO BE IN A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR AND THIS GRANT WILL ASSIST IN MAINTAINING THAT STATUS. ACTIVITIES FUNDED UNDER THIS GRANT WILL INCLUDE RAIL CAR REHABILITATION CATENARY AND SIGNAL IMPROVEMENTS RAILCAR AND NETWORK SYSTEM COMPONENT IMPROVEMENTS BRIDGE REHABILITATION STATION IMPROVEMENTS SUPPORT VEHICLES TRACK AND SHOP EQUIPMENT RAIL AND ROLLING STOCK ENGINEERING RAIL UPGRADES AND IMPROVEMENTS AND A RAIL CAR ROLLING STOCK LEASE. PRE-AWARD AUTHORITY IS BEING RESERVED FOR THESE ACTIVITIES. THE TOTAL PROJECT COSTS FOR THESE PROJECTS IS $38631739 WITH THE LOCAL SHARE ($7726347) COMING FROM NICTDS GENERAL FUND WHICH CONSISTS OF PROCEEDS FROM THE STATE OF INDIANAS COMMUTER RAIL SERVICE FUND AND TRACKAGE RIGHTS PAYMENTS FROM THE SOUTH SHORE (FREIGHT) RAILROAD THAT OPERATES ON NICTDS TRACKAGE. NICTD DOES NOT HAVE ANY ACTIVITIES IN THIS GRANT PURCHASING NEW REVENUE VEHICLES BUT THERE IN AN ACTIVITY FOR LEASED VEHICLES. IN EXECUTING THIS GRANT NICTD AGREES TO ABIDE BY SECTION 3011 OF THE FAST ACT (49 U.S.C. 5323(J)(2)(C) REGARDING THE PHASED INCREASE IN DOMESTIC CONTENT UNDER THE BUY AMERICA STATUTE FOR ROLLING STOCK. AS THIS GRANT AGREEMENT INCLUDES AND FTA-FUNDED TRANSIT VEHICLE PURCHASE NICTD AGREES TO COMPLY WITH THE RELATED REQUIREMENTS SET FORTH IN 49 CFR 26.49(A). SPECIFICALLY NICTD WILL ENSURE AS A CONDITION OF BEING AUTHORIZED TO BID OR PROPOSE ON FTA-ASSISTED TRANSIT VEHICLE PROCUREMENTS THAT EACH TRANSIT VEHICLE MANUFACTURER CERTIFIED THAT IT COMPLIED WITH DOT REQUIREMENTS FOR SUBMITTING A DBE PROGRAM AND GOAL TO FTA PRIOR TO BIDDING. RECIPIENT IS ALSO REQUIRED TO SUBMIT THE NAME OF THE SUCCESSFUL BIDDER AND THE TOTAL DOLLAR VALUE OF THE CONTRACT WITHIN 30 DAYS OF MAKING AN FTA ASSISTED TRANSIT VEHICLE AWARD USING THE REQUIRED FTA REPORTING TOOL. RECIPIENT UNDERSTANDS THAT FAILURE TO COMPLY WITH THESE REQUIREMENTS MAY RESULT IN FORMAL ENFORCEMENT ACTION OR APPROPRIATE SANCTION AS DETERMINED BY FTA INCLUDING REIMBURSEMENT OF FTA FUNDS USED FOR THE VEHICLE PROCUREMENT.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS GRANT WILL RESULT IN THE CONTINUATION OF NICTDS ONGOING RAIL CAR REHABILITATION PROGRAM IMPROVEMENTS TO THE TRACK SYSTEM (INCLUSIVE OF CATENARY AND SIGNAL UPGRADES) ACCOUNTING FOR REPLACEMENT OF RAIL BEYOND ITS USEFUL LIFE AS WELL AS SAFETY UPGRADES ASSOCIATED WITH TRACK IMPROVEMENTS IMPROVED FUNCTIONALITY OF NICTDS NETWORK SYSTEMS CURRENTLY FAILING MAINTENANCE ON TWO OF NICTDS LARGER BRIDGES EXTENDING THEIR USEFUL LIFE MAINTENANCE OF EXISTING STATIONS REPLACEMENT OF SUPPORT VEHICLES TRACK AND SHOP EQUIPMENT ENGINEERING COMPLETION OF THE TRACK RECONFIGURATION JOINT PROJECTS WITH METRA AND THE FIRST LEASE PAYMENTS FOR THE RAIL CAR ROLLING STOCK LEASE BETWEEN NICTD AND METRA.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: NICTDS WORK ON THESE CAPITAL PROJECTS WILL BENEFIT THE SERVICE PROVIDED TO COMMUTERS ON OUR SERVICE. ALL WORK UNDER THIS GRANT WILL ASSIST IN NICTD MAINTAINING ITS FEDERALLY FUNDED ASSETS IN A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR AS WELL AS PROVIDE A MORE RELIABLE AND SAFE SERVICE FOR BOTH PASSENGERS AND STAFF.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE.ATTACHMENTS TO THIS APPLICATION INCLUDE TIP DOCUMENTATION SUPPORTING THE ALIS WITHIN THIS GRANT AND THE FTA STIP APPROVAL LETTER DATED 8/13/2019.

THIS APPLICATION IS TO REQUEST $79032912 IN SECTION 5337 FIXED GUIDEWAY FUNDS ($85072 FROM REMAINING FFY 2021 AND $78947840 FROM FFY2022) $564514 IN SECTION 5337 HIMB FUNDS (FROM FFY2021) AND $35574050 IN SECTION 5307 URBANIZED AREA FORMULA FUNDS ($11054430 FROM FFY2021 AND $24519620 FROM FFY2022) APPORTIONED TO THE ATLANTA UZA AND SUBALLOCATED TO THE METROPOLITAN ATLANTA RAPID TRANSIT AUTHORITY (MARTA) IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE ATLANTA METROPOLITAN REGIONAL POLICY.PURPOSE: TO SECURE $115171476 IN FEDERAL FUNDS TO BE MATCHED WITH $28792871 IN LOCAL FUNDS; WITH A TOTAL ELIGIBLE COST/GRANT APPLICATION OF $143964347 WHICH WILL BE USED TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO SUPPORT CRITICAL MARTA CAPITAL AND PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE RELATED BUS AND RAIL ACTIVITIES. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE GRANT FUNDS WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE (BUS RAIL) RAIL STATION RAIL TRANSITWAY LINE REHABILITATION AND SECURITY/CRIME PREVENTION ACTIVITIES FOR THE AUTHORITY.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: COMPLETION OF THE GRANT FUNDED ACTIVITIES WILL IMPROVE SERVICE DELIVERY ENHANCE THE CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE ASSIST WITH MEETING PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE STANDARDS AND ENSURE THAT ASSETS ARE MAINTAINED IN A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: MARTA PATRONS WITHIN THE SERVICE AREA OF CLAYTON DEKALB FULTON AND THE CITY OF ATLANTA. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE PEACHTREE GATEWAY PARTNERSHIP WILL SERVE AS A SUBRECIPIENT UNDER THIS AWARD TO SUPPORT THE PLANNING AND ORGANIZING EFFORTS TO PLAN AND IMPLEMENT THE I-285 TOP END ELT. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES WILL BE COMPLETED UNDER SCOPE ALI CODE (METROPOLITAN PLANNING (442-00) - 44.22.00).THE GRANT APPLICATION INCLUDES 1% OF THE AUTHORITYS FY22 SECTION 5307 APPORTIONMENT-$6631837 FOR SECURITY/SAFETY RELATED IMPROVEMENTS (ALIS 11.42.09 12.42.09). THE INCLUSION SURPASSES THE 0.75% REQUIREMENT OF THE BI-PARTISAN INFRASTRUCTURE LAW. THE AUTHORITY AND SUB-GRANTEES WILL FOLLOW ALL 3RD PARTY PROCUREMENT POLICIES AS DEFINED IN C4220.1F (THIRD PARTY CONTRACTING GUIDANCE) AND 2 CFR 2020. THE AUTHORITY WILL ENSURE THAT CONTRACTORS PROCURED ARE NOT ON THE FTA SUSPENSION AND DEBARMENT LIST. THE APPROVED INDIRECT COST PLAN (CAP) DOCUMENTATION IS ATTACHED TO THE RECIPIENT PROFILE FOR CONSIDERATION.THE LOCAL MATCHING SHARE FOR THE GRANT APPLICATION IS PROVIDED FROM THE 1% DEDICATED MARTA SALES AND USE TAX FROM CLAYTON DEKALB AND FULTON COUNTIES AND THE CITY OF ATLANTA AS WELL AS THE SALE OF ASSOCIATED SALES TAX REVENUE BONDS AS REQUIRED.

THE NON-FEDERAL SHARE WILL BE PROVIDED BY THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA AND THE STATE OF MARYLAND AND PARTICIPATING JURISDICTIONS IN THE COMMONWEALTH OF VIRGINIA. WMATAS CURRENT TRANSIT ASSET MANAGEMENT (TAM) PLAN WAS ADOPTED ON OCTOBER 21 2018 AND WILL BE UPDATED IN ACCORDANCE WITH CURRENT REGULATIONS BY OCTOBER 2022. PROJECTS INCLUDED HEREIN REFLECT THE GOALS OF THE TAM PLAN. THIS REQUEST SUPPORTS THE BELOW PROJECTS. PURPOSE OF AWARD: THE PURPOSE IS TO SUPPORT WMATAS CAPITAL IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM FOR FY2023 INCLUDING THE REHABILITATION OF THE YELLOW LINE BRIDGE AND TUNNEL THE REHABILITATION OF TRACK AND PEDESTRIAN BRIDGES TO A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR AND THE CONSTRUCTION OF THE HRO FACILITY.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: ACTIVITIES INCLUDE THE REHABILITATION OF YELLOW LINE BRIDGE REPLACEMENT OF THE L-LINE DRY STANDPIPE AND TUNNEL STEEL LINER; STRUCTURAL REPAIRS TO TWENTY BRIDGES (TRACK AND PEDESTRIAN); AND THE CONSTRUCTION OF THE HRO FACILITY FOR MAINTENANCE AND STORAGE OF THE RAIL FLEET AND ADMINISTRATIVE RAIL OPERATIONS.EXPECTED OUTCOME: THE PROJECTS WILL INCREASE SAFETY AND RELIABILITY OF THE RAIL TRANSIT SYSTEM FOR ITS CUSTOMERS AND WMATA EMPLOYEES AND PROVIDE FOR MODERN AND SAFE RAIL OPERATIONS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: WMATAS BENEFICIARIES ARE WMATA EMPLOYEES AND WMATA CUSTOMERS WHO COMMUTE WITHIN OR CONNECT TO PUBLIC TRANSIT WITHIN THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA VIRGINIA AND MARYLAND REGION. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENTS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS AWARD.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THIS AWARD WILL PROVIDE FUNDING FOR THE UNDERGRADE RAILROAD BRIDGES AND THE MNR WORK FORCES REQUIRED FOR THE PROJECT AS WELL AS THE WALK BRIDGE REPLACEMENT PROJECT TO IMPROVE THE RELIABILITY AND STATE OF GOOD REPAIR OF THE RAILROAD IN NORWALK CT.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THE WALK BRIDGE REPLACEMENT PROJECT CONSISTS OF THE REPLACEMENT OF THE EXISTING BRIDGE WITH A NEW MULTI-SPAN BRIDGE INCLUDING 240-FOOT DUAL LIFT SPANS OVER THE NAVIGABLE WATERWAY WITH FIXED EAST AND WEST APPROACH SPANS. THE WALK BRIDGE MNR BYPASS INCLUDES ESTABLISHMENT OF SITE ACCESS MOORINGS AND STAGING AREAS INSTALLATION OF NEW COPPER AND FIBER-OPTIC COMMUNICATION AND SIGNAL SYSTEM CABLES AND TRACTION AND SIGNAL POWER CABLES UNDER THE NORWALK RIVER (MNR BY-PASS) CONSTRUCTION OF TEMPORARY WORK PLATFORMS LIFT TOWER FOUNDATIONS AND THE BOTTOM HALF OF THE LIFT PIERS AS WELL AS INSTALLATION OF NEW CATENARY FOUNDATIONS AND STRUCTURES. ANCILLARY WORK INCLUDES THE VESSEL RELOCATION DREDGING AND WETLAND IMPROVEMENTS.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: ENHANCE THE SAFETY AND RELIABILITY OF RAIL SERVICE OFFER OPERATIONAL FLEXIBILITY AND EASE OF MAINTENANCE AND PROVIDE FOR INCREASED CAPACITY AND EFFICIENCIES OF RAIL TRANSPORTATION ALONG THE NHL/NEC WHILE IMPROVING NAVIGATIONAL CAPACITY AND DEPENDABILITY FOR MARINE TRAFFIC IN THE NORWALK RIVER.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROJECT INCLUDE THE NORTHEAST CORRIDOR METRO-NORTH RAILROAD AMTRAK THE NEW HAVEN LINE PASSENGERS AS WELL AS TRANSIT COMMUTERS STATEWIDE.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: WALK BRIDGE REPLACEMENT- MNR BYPASS- INSTALLATION/CONSTRUCTION/IMPROVEMENTSWORK FORCES - MNR RAILROAD PROTECTIVE SERVICES AS REQUIRED ENGINEERING/DESIGN PROJECT MANAGEMENT DOCUMENT SUBMITTAL AND REVIEW

EXPECTED OUTCOMES: A TOTAL OF 39 BEBS WILL BE PURCHASED FOR CTTRANSIT DIVISIONS AND OTHER OPERATORS STATEWIDE INCLUDING MILFORD TRANSIT DISTRICT MIDDLETOWN AREA TRANSIT AND GREATER BRIDGEPORT TRANSIT REPLACING BUSES THAT HAVE EXCEEDED THEIR USEFUL LIFE BENCHMARK AND DEPLOYING ZERO EMISSION BEBS IN THEIR PLACE. ONGOING FACILITY IMPROVEMENTS/UPGRADES RELATED TO THE ELECTRIFICATION OF CTTRANSIT HARTFORDS H2 BUILDING.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: ALL COMMUNITIES WILL BENEFIT FROM IMPROVED AIR QUALITY RESULTING FROM DECREASED CARBON EMISSIONS AND HAVE THE EQUAL POTENTIAL TO BENEFIT FROM MORE RELIABLE SERVICE DUE TO RANDOM BUS ASSIGNMENT POLICIES. THIS IS A CONTINUATION OF THE TRACK PROGRAM PROJECT INCLUDED IN FTA GRANTS: FTA GRANTS: CT-2017-017 $10000000 TOTAL ($8000000 FEDERAL/ $2000000 STATE)CT-2018-008 $10000000 TOTAL ($8000000 FEDERAL/ $2000000 STATE)CT-2018-014 $7000000 TOTAL ($5600000 FEDERAL/ $1400000 STATE)CT-2020-020 $14000000 TOTAL ($11200000 FEDERAL/ $2800000 STATE)TOTAL TO DATE $41000000. ALL WORK IS BASED ON THE ANNUAL CYCLE IN ORDER TO MAINTAIN OPERATING SPEEDS AND COMFORT.3) NHL WATERBURY SIGNAL - FUNDING REQUEST OF $20000000 ($16000000 FEDERAL/$4000000 STATE) FOR SIGNAL UPGRADES ON THE NEW HAVEN RAIL LINE. THIS PROJECT IS A CONTINUATION OF THE WATERBURY SIGNAL PROGRAM PROJECT WHICH IS INCLUDED IN FTA GRANT: * CT-2018-008 $121875000 TOTAL ($97500000 FEDERAL; $24375000 STATE)THE WATERBURY BRANCH LINE IS APPROXIMATELY A 27 MILE STRETCH OF SINGLE LINE TRACK FROM MILFORD TO WATERBURY. THE BRANCH LINE IS CURRENTLY MANUAL SIGNAL BLOCK TERRITORY OR DARK TERRITORY WHERE ONLY ONE TRAIN IS ALLOWED ON THE ENTIRE BRANCH LINE AT A TIME. THIS PROJECT WILL IMPLEMENT THE INSTALLATION OF A CAB SIGNAL SYSTEM WITH AUTOMATIC TRAIN CONTROL ON THE TWENTY-SEVEN (27) MILE WATERBURY BRANCH. SIGNALIZATION OF THE BRANCH LINE WILL INSTALL MODERN CAB SIGNAL TECHNOLOGY TO LIGHT THE WAY SO MULTIPLE TRAINS COULD SAFELY OCCUPY THE BRANCH LINE SIMULTANEOUSLY THEREFORE RESULTING IN INCREASED TRAIN CAPACITY AND SAFER TRAIN OPERATIONS. ALONG WITH THE NEW SIGNAL SYSTEM WILL COME (4) FOUR PASSING SIDINGS IN DEVON DERBY BEACON FALLS AND WATERBURY. THESE SIDINGS WILL BE INTERLOCKED AT BOTH ENDS. THERE ARE A TOTAL OF 16 RAILROAD CROSSINGS PUBLIC AND PRIVATE ALONG THE LINE. SOME OF THESE CROSSINGS WILL BE PERMANENTLY CLOSED IN THE FUTURE AND MOST OF THE REST IF NOT ALL OF THE RAILROAD CROSSINGS WILL RECEIVE FULL PROTECTION UPGRADES WITH ACTIVE WARNING DEVICES (GATES AND FLASHERS). THIS PROJECT WILL ALLOW FOR INCREASED CAPACITY AND FREQUENCY OF SERVICE ON THE WATERBURY LINE.4) DARIEN RAILROAD STATION IMPROVEMENTS - FUNDING REQUEST OF $45000000 ($36000000 FEDERAL/$9000000 STATE) FOR FUNDING FOR IMPROVEMENTS TO THE DARIEN RAILROAD STATION LOCATED ON THE METRO-NORTH RAILROAD NEW HAVEN MAIN LINE IN DARIEN CONNECTICUT.BY EXECUTING THIS GRANT WE CERTIFY THAT PROJECTS FUNDED IN THIS GRANT ARE INCLUDED IN THE 2018 TRANSIT ASSET MANAGEMENT (TAM) PLAN INVESTMENT PRIORITIZATION SECTION. ALL ADMINISTRATIVE AND STATUTORY REQUIREMENTS HAVE BEEN MET IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE 5337 STATE OF GOOD REPAIR FORMULA PROGRAM AS ARTICULATED IN CIRCULAR 5300.1.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO SUPPORT METROS REMAINING FY23-25 PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE ACTIVITIES APPLIED TO RAIL VEHICLES FACILITIES AND SYSTEMS INCLUDING LIGHT RAIL AND HEAVY RAIL WAYSIDE MAINTENANCE MAINTENANCE SUPPORT NON-REVENUE VEHICLES MAINTENANCE AND OTHER MAINTENANCE WITHIN LOS ANGELES COUNTY DURING THE PERIOD OF APRIL 16 2023 THROUGH SEPTEMBER 30 2024.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR RAIL PM EQUIPMENT/MATERIALS/SUPPLIES (SUCH AS TRACTION MOTORS AUXILIARY POWER UNIT INVERTERS LUBRICATING BOXES NUT AND PIN ASSEMBLY SCREWS TRAVELING CAR NUTS ETC.) AND ACTIVITIES OF RAIL VEHICLES FACILITIES AND SYSTEMS INCLUDING LIGHT RAIL AND HEAVY RAIL WAYSIDE MAINTENANCE MAINTENANCE SUPPORT NON-REVENUE VEHICLES MAINTENANCE AND OTHER MAINTENANCE IN LOS ANGELES COUNTY DURING THE PERIOD OF APRIL 16 2023 THROUGH SEPTEMBER 30 2024.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING FOR RAIL PM ACTIVITIES IS CRITICAL TO ENSURE THE LACMTA RAIL SYSTEM INCLUDING VEHICLES AND FACILITIES IS MAINTAINED IN A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR SO THAT IT OPERATES SAFELY EFFICIENTLY RELIABLY AND SUSTAINABLY. THESE ACTIVITIES WILL ALSO SUSTAIN LOWER FLEET OPERATING COSTS LOWER EQUIPMENT OPERATING COSTS AND LOWER FACILITY OPERATING COSTS. THEY WILL ALSO REDUCE UNSCHEDULED REPAIRS.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: RAIL RIDERS INCLUDING SENIORS PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES LOW-INCOME AND TRANSIT DEPENDENT INDIVIDUALS AND THOSE WHO DO NOT HAVE ALTERNATIVE OPTIONS FOR ESSENTIAL TRIPS. THE ACTIVITIES UNDER THE RAIL PM PROGRAM ARE CRITICAL TO ENSURE THAT METROS RAIL VEHICLES ARE MAINTAINED IN A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR TO ENHANCE SAFETY AVAILABILITY RELIABILITY AND SYSTEM-WIDE COMPATIBILITY. IF LACMTA IS UNABLE TO PROVIDE PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE SERVICES RAIL VEHICLES WILL BREAK DOWN AND SERVICE WILL BE SIGNIFICANTLY IMPACTED.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO SERVICE AND MAINTAIN LIGHT RAIL VEHICLES AND RELATED EQUIPMENT IN ORDER TO SUSTAIN LOWERED FACILITY AND EQUIPMENT OPERATING COSTS. THIS FUNDING WILL CONTRIBUTE TOWARD MTS ACHIEVING A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR FOR ALL TRANSIT ASSETS. THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO INCREASE SERVICE RELIABILITY BY ALLOWING THE CONTINUATION OF MTS ROBUST MAINTENANCE PROGRAM.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: SERVICE AND MAINTENANCE OF UP TO 173 LIGHT RAIL VEHICLES AND TRACK WORK PROJECTS THAT PROVIDE SERVICE ON FOUR LINES (THE UC SAN DIEGO BLUE ORANGE SYCUAN GREEN AND SDGE SILVER LINES) WITH A TOTAL OF 63 STATIONS AND 64.3 MILES OF RAIL.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: SUSTAIN LOWERED FACILITY AND EQUIPMENT OPERATING COSTS AND CONTRIBUTE TOWARD MTS ACHIEVING A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR FOR ALL TRANSIT ASSETS. THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO INCREASE SERVICE RELIABILITY BY ALLOWING THE CONTINUATION OF MTS ROBUST MAINTENANCE PROGRAM.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: ABOUT 570 SQUARE MILES OF THE URBANIZED AREAS OF SAN DIEGO COUNTY AS WELL AS THE RURAL PARTS OF EAST COUNTY 3240 TOTAL SQUARE MILES. SERVING APPROXIMATELY 3 MILLION PEOPLE IN SAN DIEGO COUNTY AS WELL AS VISITORS AND NEIGHBORING NAVAL STATION.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: MTS DOES NOT INTEND TO SUB-AWARD FUNDS.

NO FUEL COSTS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS GRANT APPLICATION.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS GRANT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING TO ENSURE THE SCRRA CAN CONTINUE TO PROVIDE SERVICE BY MAINTAINING A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR FOR EQUIPMENT AND FACILITIES THAT SUPPORT RAIL OPERATIONS AND IMPROVE AIR QUALITY.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THESE PROJECTS ARE PATRONS THAT UTILIZE SCRRA SERVICES.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: METROLINK DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THIS GRANT REQUESTS $28503453 OF FFY2020 FFY2021 AND FFY2022 FTA SECTION 5337 AND $10880800 IN FFY2022 5307 FUNDS FOR METROLINK INFRASTRUCTURE REHABILITATION ROLLING STOCK COMPONENT REHABILITATION AND FOR PURCHASE UPGRADE OR REPLACEMENT OF EQUIPMENT AND SYSTEMS TO IMPROVE CONDITION SAFETY AND FUNCTIONALITY.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: - REHABILITATE RAILROAD ASSETS INCLUDING RAIL TIES BALLAST TURNOUTS SWITCHES OTHER TRACK MATERIAL TRACK PANELS GRADE CROSSING COMPONENTS PEDESTRIAN CROSSINGS MAINTENANCE OF WAY INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO MINOR GRADING OF THE RAILROAD RIGHT OF WAY ADJACENT TO THE PROJECTS ACTIVITIES LIKE MAKING SURE CROSSINGS/TURNOUTS ARE THE PROPER ELEVATIONS OR SIGNAL HOUSES HAVE LEVEL GROUND FOR PLACEMENT REPAIR OF FENCING PLACEMENT OF BLOCKS COMMUNICATION AND SIGNAL COMPONENTS TRAIN CONTROL SYSTEMS (INCLUDING POSITIVE TRAIN CONTROL (PTC) SIGNAGE PASSENGER INFORMATION SYSTEMS AND ASSET MANAGEMENT SYSTEMS. PEDESTRIAN CROSSINGS WILL MEET ADA ACCESSIBILITY GUIDELINES.- REHABILITATE UPGRADE OR REPLACE SERVICE AND SHOP EQUIPMENT SYSTEMS AND NON-REVENUE VEHICLES. - REHABILITATE SELECTED ROLLING STOCK COMPONENTS AND SUBSYSTEMS SUCH AS DOOR CONTROL COMPONENTS AND HVAC UNITS.- REHABILITATION WORK WILL TAKE PLACE ACROSS METROLINKS COMMUTER RAIL SUBDIVISIONS AS WELL AS WITHIN METROLINKS FACILITIES SUCH AS THE CENTRAL MAINTENANCE FACILITY (CMF) EASTERN MAINTENANCE FACILITY (EMF) LAYOVER YARDS AND BUILDINGS. ROLLING STOCK COMPONENT REHABILITATION MAY TAKE PLACE WITHIN VENDOR FACILITIES.- PURCHASE OF 10 NEW TIER IV LOCOMOTIVES WILL BE PURCHASED WITH FUNDS PROVIDED BY THIS GRANT TO REPLACE 10 MP36 LOCOMOTIVES. THE USEFUL LIFE OF THE LOCOMOTIVES IS 25 YEARS.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: REHABILITATION WORK WILL KEEP COMMUTER RAIL ASSETS IN A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR AND WILL SUSTAIN SERVICE RELIABILITY AND OPERATIONAL SAFETY.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE ENTIRE SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA REGION BENEFITS FROM A WELL-MAINTAINED COMMUTER RAIL SYSTEM. CURRENT AND FUTURE RIDERS ENJOY A RELIABLE EFFICIENT SYSTEM TO GET THEM TO THEIR DESTINATION. THE GENERAL PUBLIC RECEIVES AN IMPROVED QUALITY OF LIFE THAT PUBLIC TRANSIT OFFERS INCLUDING CONGESTION AND POLLUTION RELIEF.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: AS A DIRECT RECIPIENT OF SUBALLOCATED FUNDS METROLINK DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO SECURE FUNDS FOR CAPITAL ACTIVITIES TO KEEP NCTDS ASSETS IN STATE OF GOOD REPAIR ACCORDING TO TRANSIT ASSET MANAGEMENT PLAN (TAM).; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: THIS GRANT WILL FUND THE PLANNING DESIGN AND CONSTRUCTION ACTIVITIES ASSOCIATED WITH NCTD FACILITIES AND RIGHT-OF-WAY. INCLUDED IN THIS GRANT APPLICATION ARE FUNDS USED TO COVER ALL ELIGIBLE PM OPERATING EXPENSES SUPPLIES MATERIALS LABOR SERVICES AND ASSOCIATED COSTS REQUIRED TO PRESERVE OR EXTEND THE FUNCTIONALITY AND SERVICEABILITY OF THE RAIL FLEET AND MAINTENANCE FACILITIES ASSETS IN A COST-EFFECTIVE MANNER.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL PERMIT NORTH COUNTY TRANSIT DISTRICT TO BUILD AN INTEGRATED TRANSIT SYSTEM THAT ENABLES OUR CUSTOMERS TO TRAVEL EASILY AND EFFICIENTLY THROUGHOUT OUR GROWING REGION AND TO KEEP OUR ASSETS IN A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: SAN DIEGO NORTH COUNTY GENERAL PUBLIC AND LOCAL AREA COMMUTERS.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUB-AWARD FUNDS.

THE SFMTA WILL USE A TOTAL OF $144252435 IN FY 2022 5337 STATE OF GOOD REPAIR FUNDS FOR WAYSIDE/CENTRAL TRAIN CONTROL TROLLEY SIGNAL SYSTEMS LIGHT RAIL VEHICLE REPLACEMENT PROCUREMENTS CABLE CAR RESTORATIONS MUNI RAIL REPLACEMENT OVERHEAD LINE REHABILITATION AND CABLE CAR INFRASTRUCTURE. THE REQUIRED LOCAL SHARE OF $36063109 WILL BE FUNDED WITH LOCAL SALES TAXES DEVELOPER FEES AND FARE REVENUES. PLEASE NOTE THAT THE LRV REPLACEMENT PROJECT IS ONLY FOR REPLACING EXISTING LRV FLEET VEHICLES WITH PLANNED RETIREMENTS. THE FUNDS WILL NOT BE USED TO EXPAND THE LRV FLEET AND THE SCHEDULE OF PLANNED LRV RETIREMENTS AND RELATED BOOK VALUES IS ATTACHED TO THE PROJECT DOCUMENTS IN THIS GRANT APPLICATION.PURPOSE:THIS GRANT WILL ALLOW SFMTA TO IMPROVE SAFETY/RAIL SERVICE EFFICIENCY LRV/CABLE CAR RELIABILITY RAIL TRACK SAFETY OVERHEAD LINE RELIABILITY AND CABLE CAR SYSTEM RELIABILITY.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:PROCURE TRAIN CONTROL/TROLLEY SIGNAL SYSTEM SERVICES LRVS CABLE CAR RESTORATION SERVICES RAIL REPLACEMENT SERVICES OVERHEAD LINE REHAB SERVICES AND CABLE CAR INFRASTRUCTURE SERVICES.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:TRANSIT INFRASTRUCTURE AND OPERATING SYSTEMS WILL MAINTAIN AND IMPROVE SAFETY RELIABILITY AND EFFICIENCY OF SAN FRANCISCOS CRITICAL TRANSIT SERVICE SYSTEM.INTENDED BENEFICIARIESTHE RESIDENTS OF SAN FRANCISCO AS WELL AS THE COMMUNITY OF THE GREATER BAY AREA RELY ON AFFORDABLE ACCESSIBLE AND DEPENDABLE TRANSIT SERVICE. WITHOUT THIS SERVICE MANY PEOPLE WOULD NOT BE ABLE TO TRAVEL TO WORK SHOP FOR FOOD OR OBTAIN NEEDED MEDICAL CARE. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:THERE WILL BE NO SUBRECIPIENTS FOR THIS PROJECT.ALLOWABLE CAPITAL PROJECT COSTS UNDER THIS GRANT FOLLOW THE GUIDELINES AND PRINCIPLES CONTAINED IN OMBS UNIFORM ADMINISTRATIVE REQUIREMENTS COST PRINCIPLES AND AUDIT REQUIREMENTS FOR FEDERAL AWARDS CIRCULAR (SUPER CIRCULAR). ELIGIBLE COSTS ARE THOSE ASSOCIATED WITH THE ACQUISITION CONSTRUCTION IMPROVEMENT AND MAINTENANCE OF FACILITIES AND EQUIPMENT FOR USE IN TRANSIT AND INCLUDE CAPITAL PROCUREMENTS ROLLING STOCK PURCHASES DESIGN AND CONSTRUCTION COSTS AND THE FORCE ACCOUNT (PERSONNEL) EXPENDITURES REQUIRED TO SUPPORT THESE CAPITAL PROJECT ACTIVITIES.THE FUNDS ARE ALLOCATED TO THE SFO UZA AND ARE APPROVED BY THE MTC IN THE FOLLOWING TIP NUMBERS: SF050024 $24272000 SF090012 $108635101 SF970073 $2293334 SF95037B $3639000 SF970170 $2930000 AND SF99T002 $2483000.THE 5337 FUNDS IN THIS APPLICATION ARE INCLUDED IN THE INVESTMENT PRIORITIZATION SECTION OF SFMTAS TAM PLAN.

THIS APPLICATION IS FOR FFY19 FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $1660606 FROM THE 5337 STATE OF GOOD REPAIR PROGRAM AND $1409473 FROM THE 5307 URBANIZED FORMULA PROGRAM TOTALING $3070079 IN FFY19 FTA FUNDING FOR THE RAILCAR MIDLIFE OVERHAUL. THIS APPLICATION ALSO INCLUDES FFY20 FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $2376031 FROM THE 5337 STATE OF GOOD REPAIR PROGRAM AND $24266 FROM THE 5307 URBANIZED AREA FORMULA PROGRAM TOTALING $2400297 IN FFY20 FTA FUNDING FOR THE RAILCAR MIDLIFE OVERHAUL. THE APPLICATION ALSO INCLUDES FFY21 FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $423969 FROM THE 5337 STATE OF GOOD REPAIR PROGRAM FOR THE RAILCAR MIDLIFE OVERHAUL. WITH ALL FUNDING YEARS COMBINED THIS EQUALS $4460606 IN 5337 FUNDS AND $1433739 IN 5307 FUNDS FOR A TOTAL FEDERAL FUNDING REQUEST OF $5894345. $1473587 IN MATCHING FUNDS WILL BE PROVIDED FROM THE LOCAL STATE OF GOOD REPAIR FUNDS AND STATE RAIL ASSISTANCE (SRA) FUNDS. ALL FEDERAL FUNDING AMOUNTS REQUESTED IN THE GRANT BY FTA PROGRAM FISCAL YEAR AND UZA ARE LISTED IN MTCS JULY 21 2021 CONCURRENCE LETTER IN APPLICATION DOCUMENTS.PURPOSE OF THE AWARD: THE FFY21 RAILCAR MIDLIFE OVERHAUL PROJECT WILL ENABLE ACES 30 ACE RAILCARS TO CONTINUE TO BE MAINTAINED REPAIRED AND/OR UPGRADED TO ENSURE THAT THEY REMAIN IN A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR AND OPERATE AT MAXIMUM CAPACITY THROUGHOUT THEIR USEFUL LIFE. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THIS GRANT WILL FUND THE CONTINUED MIDLIFE OVERHAUL AND RELATED ACTIVITIES FOR ACES FLEET OF 30 RAILCARS INCLUDING FLOORING LIGHTING SEATING PAINT AND ELECTRICAL OUTLETS EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE MIDLIFE OVERHAUL OF ACES FLEET OF 30 RAILCARS WILL ENSURE THAT THE SERVICE WILL CONTINUE TO OPERATE AT MAXIMUM PERFORMANCE FOR THE 1.5 MILLION ANNUAL PASSENGERS USING THE ACE SERVICE. ADDITIONAL BENEFITS OF THE PROJECT INCLUDE AN EXTENDED USEFUL LIFE FOR THE RAILCARS FULFILLMENT OF ELEMENTS OF SJRRCS TRANSIT ASSET MANAGEMENT (TAM) PLAN REDUCED REACTIVE MAINTENANCE COSTS DECREASED FREQUENCY AND DURATION OF SERVICE DELAYS DUE TO EQUIPMENT FAILURE AND ENHANCE ACE SERVICE. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE RAILCAR MIDLIFE OVERHAUL PROJECT WILL TAKE PLACE AT THE RAIL MAINTENANCE FACILITY (RMF) LOCATED AT 1020 E. ALPINE AVENUE STOCKTON CA 95204. UPON PROJECT COMPLETION THE REHABILITATED FLEET OF 30 RAILCARS WILL BE PUT INTO REVENUE SERVICE ON THE ACE CORRIDOR. THE CITIES AND COUNTIES THAT THE ACE CORRIDOR OPERATES WITHIN INCLUDE LATHROP/MANTECA AND TRACY IN SAN JOAQUIN COUNTY; THE CITIES OF LIVERMORE PLEASANTON AND FREMONT IN ALAMEDA COUNTY; AND THE CITIES OF SANTA CLARA AND SAN JOSE IN SANTA CLARA COUNTY.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: N/A

FUNDING FOR THE PROJECT INCLUDED IN THIS GRANT APPLICATION IS PROVIDED BY THE FOLLOWING APPORTIONMENT YEAR AND URBANIZED AREAS (UZAS):SECTION 5337 HIFG FFY2021 LOS ANGELES/LONG BEACH/ANAHEIM (UZA#60020): $616000SECTION 5337 HIMB FFY2021 LOS ANGELES/LONG BEACH/ANAHEIM (UZA #60020): $2225611SECTION 5337 HIMB FFY2021 RIVERSIDE-SAN BERNARDINO (UZA #60420): $433151TOTAL FFY2021 SECTION 5337: $3274762OVERALL GRANT FUNDING:TOTAL FEDERAL FUNDS: $3274762TRANSPORTATION DEVELOPMENT CREDITS: $654952TOTAL ELIGIBLE PROJECT COST: $3274762A PORTION OF THE LOCAL SHARE IS PROVIDED BY TRANSPORTATION DEVELOPMENT CREDITS (TDCS). BECAUSE TDCS DO NOT ALLOCATE ACTUAL MONEY TOWARD PROJECT EXPENSES A 100% FEDERAL SHARE IS REFLECTED WHERE THE CREDITS ARE APPLIED. PURPOSE OF THE AWARD THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING FOR PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE OF FACILITIES TO ALLOW OCTA TO PROVIDE EFFICIENT AND DEPENDABLE TRANSIT SERVICE IN ORANGE COUNTY CALIFORNIA INSTALL TACTILE TILES TO AID THE VISUALLY IMPAIRED AT SEVERAL METROLINK STATIONS IN ORANGE COUNTY AND PROVIDE FUNDING TO SUPPORT THE ENVIRONMENTAL AND DESIGN PHASE TO DETERMINE APPROPRIATE MITIGATION MEASURES FOR SEVERAL SLOPES AND CULVERTS ALONG OCTAS RAIL RIGHT-OF-WAY IN ORANGE COUNTY. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED OCTA CERTIFIES THAT THE PROJECTS LISTED IN THIS GRANT APPLICATION ARE INCLUDED IN THE INVESTMENT PRIORITIZATION SECTION OF OUR TAM PLAN.ORANGE COUNTY TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY IS HEREBY SUBMITTING THIS GRANT APPLICATION IN SUPPORT OF THE FOLLOWING CAPITAL PROJECTS:1) FACILITIES PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE (PM) THIS GRANT APPLIES $2658762 IN FFY2021 SECTION 5337 HIMB FUNDS FOR FACILITIES PM FOR THE PERIOD OCTOBER 1 2021 TO SEPTEMBER 30 2022 (FFY2022). THE ESTIMATED EXPENSES FOR PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE DURING THIS TIME PERIOD ARE $3008942. THIS GRANT WILL APPLY FEDERAL FUNDS OF $2658762 TO THIS ALLOWABLE SHARE. THESE FUNDS WILL COVER FACILITIES PM ACTIVITIES THAT SUPPORT OUR COMMUTER/EXPRESS ROUTES. THESE ROUTES OPERATE OVER MULTIPLE HOV LANES AND THESE FUND WILL BE USED TO KEEP THE REGIONS PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION SYSTEMS IN A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR.2) TACTILE TILE REPLACEMENTTHIS GRANT APPLIES $316000 IN FFY2021 SECTION 5337 HIFG FUNDING TO SUPPORT THE COMPLETION OF REPLACEMENT OF TACTILE TILE AT METROLINK STATIONS IN ORANGE COUNTY. AS REQUIRED BY ADAS 2010 STANDARDS FOR STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENT FACILITIES SECTION 810.5.2 DETECTABLE WARNINGS FOR RAIL PLATFORMS: PLATFORM EDGES NOT PROTECTED BY PLATFORM SCREENS OR GUARDS SHALL HAVE DETECTABLE WARNINGS COMPLYING WITH ADA REGULATION 705 ALONG THE FULL LENGTH OF THE PUBLIC USE OF THE PLATFORM. ACCORDINGLY ALL METROLINK PLATFORMS ARE EQUIPPED WITH HARD PLASTIC TILES WITH RAISED TACTILE SURFACES DESIGNED TO AID THE VISUALLY IMPAIRED. AT MANY OF THE STATIONS THE TILES ARE IN NEED OF REPAIR AND/OR REPLACEMENT. THIS PROJECT PREVIOUSLY RECEIVED FUNDING IN CA-2020-039-00 ($833000 IN SECTION 5337 FUNDS) AND IN CA-90-Y-942 ($124000 IN SECTION 5307 FUNDS) AND THE FUNDS IN THIS GRANT ARE NEEDED TO COMPLETE THE PROJECT.3) RAILROAD CORRIDOR SLOPE AND CULVERT IMPROVEMENTSTHIS GRANT APPLIES $300000 IN FFY2021 SECTION 5337 HIFG FUNDING TO SUPPORT THE ENVIRONMENTAL AND DESIGN PHASE FOR RAILROAD CORRIDOR SLOPE AND CULVERT IMPROVEMENTS ON OCTAS EXISTING RIGHT-OF-WAY (ROW). THERE ARE SEVERAL LOCATIONS WHERE THE EXISTING SLOPED AREA IS SUFFERING SEVERE SOIL EROSION AND MASS WASTING ALONG THE RAILROAD POTENTIALLY PUTTING THE RAILROAD AT RISK. FUNDS WILL BE UTILIZED TO DETERMINE APPROPRIATE MITIGATION EFFORTS IN THE ENVIRONMENTAL AND DESIGN PHASE. THE RECOMMENDED MITIGATIONS WILL NOT BE FUNDED AS PART OF THIS PROJECT. SUGGESTED SOLUTIONS DETERMINED DURING DESIGN MAY INCLUDE PLACING SHOTCRETE ALONG THE EXPOSED SLOPE FACE RECOMPACTING THE SLOPE FACE AND PLACING NEW VEGETATION TO PROVIDE LONG-TERM STABILITY. FURTHERMORE AN EXISTING EARTHEN CULVERT THAT IS LOCATED ON THE PROPERTY LINE OF OCTAS ROW AND A PRIVATE DEVELOPMENT IS EXPERIENCING EROSION AND OVERGROWTH OF WEEDS AND PLANTS. EFFORTS TO MITIGATE THESE ISSUES MAY INCLUDE INSTALLING A CONCRETE LINING IN THE CULVERT AND ADDING A VEHICLE CROSSING TO PROVIDE ACCESS TO A RAILROAD SIGNAL MAST LOCATED WITHIN THE SAME AREA.EXPECTED OUTCOMES THIS GRANT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING TO ENSURE OCTA CAN CONTINUE TO PROVIDE FIXED-ROUTE TRANSIT SERVICE BY MAINTAINING A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR FOR FACILITIES THAT SUPPORT COMMUTER/EXPRESS ROUTES AND IMPROVE AIR QUALITY. IN ADDITION THE TACTILE TILE REPLACEMENT WILL AID VISUALLY IMPAIRED RIDERS TRAVELING BY RAIL AT SEVERAL METROLINK STATIONS IN ORANGE COUNTY. FUNDS WILL ALSO SUPPORT THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROCESS TO DETERMINE APPROPRIATE MITIGATION MEASURES FOR SEVERAL SLOPES AND CULVERTS ALONG OCTAS RAIL RIGHT-OF-WAY IN ORANGE COUNTY TO MAINTAIN A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR ALONG THE RAIL RIGHT-OF-WAY AND ENSURE THAT METROLINK AND AMTRAK PASSENGER SERVICE WHICH UTILIZE THE CORRIDOR CAN CONTINUE TO PROVIDE RELIABLE RAIL SERVICE AND PREVENT MAJOR SERVICE DISRUPTIONS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THESE PROJECTS ARE PATRONS THAT UTILIZE OCTAS FIXED-ROUTE SERVICE AND METROLINK AND AMTRAK RAIL SERVICE IN ORANGE COUNTY. THE RESULTING IMPROVED AIR QUALITY WILL BENEFIT ALL RESIDENTS OF ORANGE COUNTY.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES OCTA DOES NOT INTEND TO SUB-AWARD FUNDS.

PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE INCLUDES COSTS ATTRIBUTABLE TO ALL THE ACTIVITIES SUPPLIES MATERIALS LABOR SERVICES AND ASSOCIATED COSTS REQUIRED TO PRESERVE OR EXTEND THE FUNCTIONALITY AND SERVICEABILITY OF THE ASSET (VEHICLES AND MAINTENANCE FACILITIES) IN A COST-EFFECTIVE MANNER UP TO AND INCLUDING THE CURRENT STATE OF THE GOOD REPAIR FOR MAINTAINING SUCH AN ASSET.PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO SECURE FUNDS FOR CAPITAL ACTIVITIES TO KEEP NCTDS ASSETS IN STATE OF GOOD REPAIR AND PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE (PM) EXPENSES.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDED: THREE (3) HVAC UNITS AND PURCHASE OF FOUR (4) ADDITIONAL UNITS ONE (1) SPRINTER SPARE POWER PACK FIVE (5) OVERHAULS OF SPRINTER CARBODY BRAKE SYSTEM THREE (3) OVERHAULS OF SPRINTER TRUCKS IMPLEMENTATION OF A PAYROLL AND HUMAN RESOURCES SOFTWARE SYSTEM AND VITAGOLD YARD REHABILITATION. INCLUDED IN THIS GRANT APPLICATION ARE FUNDS USED TO COVER ALL ELIGIBLE PM OPERATING EXPENSES SUPPLIES MATERIALS LABOR SERVICES AND ASSOCIATED COSTS REQUIRED TO PRESERVE OR EXTEND THE FUNCTIONALITY AND SERVICEABILITY OF THE RAIL FLEET AND MAINTENANCE FACILITIES ASSETS IN A COST-EFFECTIVE MANNER. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FUNDING WILL PERMIT NORTH COUNTY TRANSIT DISTRICT TO BUILD AN INTEGRATED TRANSIT SYSTEM THAT ENABLES OUR CUSTOMERS TO TRAVEL EASILY AND EFFICIENTLY THROUGHOUT OUR GROWING REGION. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: SAN DIEGO NORTH COUNTY PUBLIC AND LOCAL AREA COMMUTERS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.
