THE PROJECT INVOLVES REPLACING AN OCTA-OWNED THREE-SPAN STEEL RAILROAD BRIDGE SUPPORTED BY TIMBER PILES ALONG THE PACIFIC SURFLINER/LOS ANGELES TO SAN DIEGO (LOSSAN) RAIL. GOLDEN GATE BRIDGE HIGHWAY TRANSPORTATION DISTRICT IS HEREBY SUBMITTING THIS GRANT APPLICATION IN THE AMOUNT OF $6171332 ($5350000 IN 5337 FIXED GUIDEWAY FUNDS AND $821332 IN 5307 FUNDS). THIS GRANT SUPPORTS THE FOLLOWING PROJECTS:1. FERRY MAJOR COMPONENTS REHAB - TIP ID: MRN150014$277332 IN 5307 FUNDING FROM THE SFO UZA (FY 21 ADA SET-ASIDE) FERRY MAJOR COMPONENTS REHAB INVOLVES REHABILITATION AND REPLACEMENT OF MAJOR FERRY COMPONENTS INCLUDING NAVIGATION SYSTEMS ONBOARD MONITORING AND ALARM SYSTEMS INTERIOR COMPONENTS BOARDING APPARATUS HULL LIFESAVING EQUIPMENT PROPULSION SYSTEMS AND OTHER FERRY COMPONENTS. 2. FERRY MAJOR COMPONENTS REHAB - TIP ID: MRN150014$4670000 IN 5337 FUNDING FROM THE SFO UZA (FY 21)FERRY MAJOR COMPONENTS REHAB INVOLVES REHABILITATION AND REPLACEMENT OF MAJOR FERRY COMPONENTS INCLUDING NAVIGATION SYSTEMS ONBOARD MONITORING AND ALARM SYSTEMS INTERIOR COMPONENTS BOARDING APPARATUS HULL LIFESAVING EQUIPMENT PROPULSION SYSTEMS AND OTHER FERRY COMPONENTS. 3. FERRY CHANNEL AND BERTH DREDGING TIP ID: MRN990017$640000 IN 5337 FUNDING FROM THE SFO UZA (FY 21)THIS PROJECT INVOLVES DREDGING THE NAVIGATION CHANNEL AND BERTH AT LARKSPUR FERRY TERMINAL TO MAINTAIN THEM AT SAFE OPERATIONAL DEPTHS TO FACILITATE CONTINUATION OF THE FERRY SERVICE.4. TRANSIT SYSTEM ENHANCEMENTS TIP ID: MRN130015$544000 IN 5307 FUNDING FROM THE SFO UZA (FY 21)TICKETING SYSTEM AND TICKET VENDING MACHINE (TVM) REPLACEMENT AND TECHNOLOGY ENHANCEMENTS TO IMPROVE FARE COLLECTION.5. GANGWAYS PIERS - TIP ID: MRN030010$40000 IN 5337 FUNDING FROM THE SFO UZA (FY 21)THE GANGWAYS PIERS PROJECT WILL INCLUDE REHABILITATING AND REPLACING THE FLOATS AND GANGWAY SYSTEMS THAT ALLOW PASSENGERS TO GET FROM THE VESSELS TO THE TERMINALS (EXTENSION OF THE FIXED GUIDEWAY IN THE MARINE ENVIRONMENT). MTS IS APPLYING FOR RAIL PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE AND LRV REPLACEMENT. FUNDING FOR ALL PROJECTS INCLUDED IN THIS GRANT APPLICATION IS PROVIDED BY THE FOLLOWING:SECTION 5337 FFY2021 SAN DIEGO (UZA #60190): $28317866.OVERALL GRANT FUNDINGTOTAL FEDERAL FUNDS: $28317866LOCAL MATCH: TDA $7079467 *EARLY DISPOSITION REMAINING FEDERAL INTEREST APPLIED AS AN ADJUSTMENT OFFSET: $90431TOTAL LOCAL MATCH: $7169898 ADJUSTED TOTAL ELIGIBLE COST: $35487764BY EXECUTING THIS GRANT WE CERTIFY THE PROJECTS FUNDED IN THIS GRANT ARE INCLUDED IN THE INVESTMENT PRIORITIZATION SECTION OF OUR TAM PLAN.MTS IS APPLYING FOR THE FOLLOWING PROJECTS:1) RAIL PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE:THIS GRANT APPLIES $ 28317866 TOWARD RAIL EQUIPMENT PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE UTILIZING PRE-AWARD AUTHORITY FOR THE PERIOD 7/1/2020 TO 6/30/2021. MTS OPERATING BUDGET FOR FIXED GUIDE-WAY SERVICE (RAIL) AS DEFINED BY NTD REPORTING SYSTEMS FOR JULY 1 2020 TO JUNE 30 2021 IS $ 78748212. ESTIMATED PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE COSTS IN THE OPERATING BUDGET FOR EQUIPMENT IS $35397333 NET OF WARRANTY RECOVERY AVAILABLE FOR FEDERAL PARTICIPATION AT THE 80/20 RATE.FTA HAS REVIEWED AND APPROVED MTSS REQUEST ON JUNE 16 2021 FOR DISPOSING OF THE FAREBOX EQUIPMENT PRIOR TO THE END OF ITS MINIMUM USEFUL LIFE TO ACCOMMODATE THE INSTALLATION AND TESTING OF THE NEW PRONTO FARE SYSTEM. THE REMAINING FEDERAL INTEREST FOR THE FAREBOX EQUIPMENT WAS CALCULATED TO BE $90431 USING STRAIGHT-LINE DEPRECIATION AND FACTORING IN THE MANUFACTURERS ESTIMATED USEFUL LIFE THE TIME IN SERVICE AND THE FEDERAL SHARE OF THE EQUIPMENT. MTS IS APPLYING THE REMAINING FEDERAL INTEREST IN THIS FTA GRANT THAT USES FORMULA FUND AND THIS $90431 AMOUNT BRINGS THE TOTAL LOCAL SHARE AMOUNT TO $7169898 ($7079467 + $90431) AND IS ALSO ENTERED IN AS AN ADJUSTMENT AMOUNT. A COPY OF THE FTA CONCURRENCE LETTER IS UPLOADED TO APPLICATION DOCUMENTS.PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO SERVICE AND MAINTAIN LIGHT RAIL VEHICLES AND RELATED EQUIPMENT IN ORDER TO SUSTAIN LOWERED FACILITY AND EQUIPMENT OPERATING COSTS. THIS FUNDING WILL CONTRIBUTE TOWARD MTS ACHIEVING A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR FOR ALL TRANSIT ASSETS. THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO INCREASE SERVICE RELIABILITY BY ALLOWING THE CONTINUATION OF MTS ROBUST MAINTENANCE PROGRAM.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: SERVICE AND MAINTAIN UP TO 173 LIGHT RAIL VEHICLES THAT PROVIDE SERVICE ON FOUR LINES (THE UC SAN DIEGO BLUE ORANGE SYCUAN GREEN AND SDGE SILVER LINES) WITH A TOTAL OF 53 STATIONS AND 54.3 MILES OF RAIL.EXPECTED OUTCOME: SUSTAIN LOWERED FACILITY AND EQUIPMENT OPERATING COSTS AND CONTRIBUTE TOWARD MTS ACHIEVING A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR FOR ALL TRANSIT ASSETS. THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO INCREASE SERVICE RELIABILITY BY ALLOWING THE CONTINUATION OF MTS ROBUST MAINTENANCE PROGRAM.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: ABOUT 570 SQUARE MILES OF THE URBANIZED AREAS OF SAN DIEGO COUNTY AS WELL AS THE RURAL PARTS OF EAST COUNTY 3240 TOTAL SQUARE MILES. SERVING APPROXIMATELY 3 MILLION PEOPLE IN SAN DIEGO COUNTY AS WELL AS VISITORS AND NEIGHBORING NAVAL STATION.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THIS RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTENT TO SUB-AWARD FUNDS.

APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO SUPPORT FUNDING FOR FACILITIES PREVENTATIVE MAINTENANCE AND THE FULLERTON METROLINK STATION STAIRS REHABILITATION. THIS WILL ALLOW OCTA TO PROVIDE EFFICIENT AND DEPENDABLE TRANSIT SERVICE IN ORANGE COUNTY.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: 1) FACILITIES PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE (PM) THIS GRANT APPLIES $2175454 IN FFY2020 SECTION 5337 HIMB FUNDS FOR VEHICLE/EQUIPMENT PM FOR THE PERIOD OCTOBER 1 2020 TO SEPTEMBER 30 2021 (FFY2021). THE ESTIMATED EXPENSES FOR PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE DURING THIS TIME PERIOD IS $23954522. THIS GRANT WILL APPLY FEDERAL FUNDS OF $2175454 TO THIS ALLOWABLE SHARE. PLEASE NOTE ADDITIONAL PM IN TEMP GRANT NO. 1682-2020-8 FOR THIS TIME PERIOD (TOTAL OF $21134421 IN FFY2020 SECTION 5307). BETWEEN THE TWO APPLICATIONS A TOTAL OF $23309875 WILL BE REQUESTED.2) FULLERTON METROLINK STATION STAIRSTHIS GRANT APPLIES $1295000 IN FY20 5337 FUNDING TO SUPPORT THE REHABILITATION OF THE STAIRCASE AT THE FULLERTON METROLINK STATION. THE EXISTING STAIRCASE IS NOT IN A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR AND THE CITY OF FULLERTON HAS CURRENTLY CLOSED THE STAIRCASE DUE TO SAFETY CONCERNS. TO FACILITATE THE EFFICIENT MOVEMENT OF PASSENGERS ESPECIALLY AT PEAK PERIODS THE STAIRCASE MUST BE REPAIRED AND REOPENED TO THE PUBLIC. THE ONLY OPTION FOR PASSENGERS TO ACCESS EITHER PLATFORM IS THROUGH THE USE OF THE SINGLE ELEVATOR. THIS IS PROBLEMATIC ESPECIALLY DURING THE CURRENT COVID19 PANDEMIC BECAUSE IT DOES NOT ALLOW PASSENGERS TO KEEP SAFE DISTANCE FROM ONE ANOTHER AND HAS CREATED DELAYS DURING PEAK HOURS WHEN MANY PEOPLE NEED TO ACCESS EACH PLATFORM. THE STAIRCASE WILL MEET ADA REQUIREMENTS AND ADAAG GUIDELINES.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FACILITIES PREVENTATIVE MAINTENANCE - THIS GRANT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING TO ENSURE OCTA CAN CONTINUE TO PROVIDE FIXED-ROUTE TRANSIT SERVICE BY MAINTAINING A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR FOR FACILITIES THAT SUPPORT COMMUTER/EXPRESS ROUTES AND IMPROVE AIR QUALITY. FULLERTON STAIRS PROJECT REPAIRING THE STAIRCASE WILL ALLOW FOR EFFICIENT MOVEMENT OF PASSENGERS ESPECIALLY AT PEAK PERIODS. THE STAIRCASE WILL MEET ADA REQUIREMENTS AND ADAAG GUIDELINES.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: FACILITIES PREVENTATIVE MAINTENANCE - THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THESE PROJECTS ARE PATRONS THAT UTILIZE OCTAS FIXED-ROUTE SERVICE AND METROLINK AND AMTRAK RAIL SERVICE IN ORANGE COUNTY. THE RESULTING IMPROVED AIR QUALITY WILL BENEFIT ALL RESIDENTS OF ORANGE COUNTY.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: OCTA DOES NOT INTEND TO SUB-AWARD FUNDS.

THE TOTAL REQUEST FOR THIS APPLICATION IS $7647499. THE FUNDS ARE MADE UP OF FEDERAL FISCAL YEAR (FFY) 2020 SECTION 5337 STATE OF GOOD REPAIR HIGH INTENSITY FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $3828981 AND FEDERAL FISCAL YEAR (FFY) 2021 FEDERAL SECTION 5337 STATE OF GOOD REPAIR HIGH INTENSITY FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $3818518 FOR THE PURCHASE OF REPLACEMENT VEHICLES AND PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE. GRANT ACTIVITIES WILL BEGIN JANUARY 2021 AND CONCLUDE BY SEPTEMBER 30 2023. THE LOCAL MATCH OF $1381125 WILL COME FROM THE REGIONAL SALES TAX. THE VEHICLE PROJECTS WILL BE FUNDED AT 85% FEDERAL WITH A 15% LOCAL MATCH AND THE PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE WILL BE FUNDED AT 80% WITH A 20% LOCAL MATCH. CITY OF PHOENIX ALONG WITH ANY SUB RECIPIENTS CERTIFY THAT THE PROJECTS LISTED IN THIS GRANT APPLICATION ARE INCLUDED IN THE INVESTMENT PRIORITIZATION SECTION OF EACH ONE OF OUR TAM PLANS.PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROVIDE FUNDS TO PURCHASE REPLACEMENT COMMUTER BUSES ARTICULATED BUSES AND PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE ACTIVITIES TO BE IS TO PURCHASE REPLACEMENT BUSES THAT WILL BE REPLACING BUSES THAT HAVE REACHED THE END OF THEIR USEFUL LIFE AND PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE EXPECTED OUTCOME IS TO PROVIDE THE NEWEST VEHICLES TO OUR PASSENGERS AND OPERATORS AS WELL AS DOING PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE ON CURRENT BUSES TO ENSURE THE VEHICLES WILL BE PROVIDING TRANSIT SERVICE.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE PASSENGERS AND OPERATORS WHO WILL BE RIDING/DRIVING THE VEHICLES..SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES INTEND TO SUBAWARD THE FUNDS TO REGIONAL PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY (RPTA).

THE TOTAL REQUEST FOR FEDERAL FISCAL YEAR (FFY) 2021 FTA SECTION 5337 STATE OF GOOD REPAIR HIGH INTENSITY FUNDS IS $73755 WHICH IS FUNDED FEDERALLY AT 80%. THE GRANT FUNDS WILL GO TOWARDS PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE FOR REGIONAL PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY (RPTA). THE LOCAL MATCH AT 20% FOR PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE IS COMING FROM THE COUNTY-WIDE TRANSIT TAX ($18439). THE PROJECT IS LISTED AS AN INVESTMENT PRIORITIZATION PROJECT AS PART OF RPTAS TRANSIT ASSET MANAGEMENT (TAM) PLAN. THE CERTIFICATION OF THE TAM PLAN HAS BEEN COMPLETED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. GRANT ACTIVITIES WILL BEGIN JULY 1 2021 AND WILL CONCLUDE BY JUNE 30 2022.PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROVIDE FUNDS TO PERFORM PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE ON VEHICLES PROVIDING TRANSIT SERVICE.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED WILL BE PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE I.E. OIL CHANGES ON BUSES THAT PROVIDE TRANSIT SERVICE.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE BEING PERFORMED WILL ENABLE THE BUS TO CONTINUE PROVIDING TRANSIT SERVICE.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE PASSENGER WHO UTILIZE THE TRANSIT SERVICE.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES INTEND TO SUBAWARD THE FUNDS TO REGIONAL PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY (RPTA).
